Celebrating over 60 Years of Servicing the Food Service Industry

For over 60 years, Handgards® has earned the respect and confidence of the food service industry as a progressive innovator in food safety. We are the industry leader in supplying quality products to our customers with fill rates above industry standards. We have been the leader for food service disposables and have flourished by retaining our industry leading ability to develop new and innovative products that help operators save time and money.

Handgards takes pride in being a leader in food safety innovations. Our extensive range of high-quality products is designed to protect end-users from costly outbreaks of food contamination. We are committed to providing exceptional service, while maintaining a high standard of quality across our entire product portfolio.

What distinguishes us from other companies in this industry is our proactive role as an innovator, manufacturer, supplier, and product consultant.

We manufacture a wide variety of films using HDPE, LDPE, mLLDPE and Nylon resins. In addition, flexographic printing on the film is available to add a distinct branding message to your products. Moreover, we continue to manufacture various products right here in the USA, ensuring quicker turnaround times while supporting local communities.

To ensure high-quality products and a commitment to food safety, we have met all the requirements to be an SQF (Safe Quality Food) certified facility. Handgards is committed to producing and supplying safe food service disposable products to every customer by adhering to regulatory standards and fostering a company-wide culture of food safety. We operate with a focus on ongoing improvements of our Food Safety Management System.

Our primary mission is to meet the needs of our customers through the delivery of high-quality products and exceptional service. With our state-of-the-art manufacturing facility, we are fully equipped to offer manufacturing solutions and expertise for any foodservice needs for many years to come. Additionally, we are actively expanding our distribution capabilities to further enhance our ability to serve customers more efficiently.

INNOVATIVE

As our customers look to us to fulfill their growing needs in disposable goods, we takes these requests and develop market leading products.​

QUALITY

With our on-site Quality Assurance teams you can rest assure that your product has been inspected and given the proper attention to satisfy your needs.

EXPERIENCE

With over 60 years in the industry we have the proven track record and expertise to provide solutions to your manufacturing needs.​

MADE IN THE USA

We have the capability to manufacture your product right here in the USA. Our manufacturing facility is located in El Paso, Texas.

Who We Are
WE OFFER PRODUCT SOLUTIONS FOR THE FOOD SERVICE INDUSTRY

We offer one of the most extensive and comprehensive lines of food safety, food protection, protective wear, and food service products in the industry. We proudly serve industry leaders and we’ve been the undisputed market leader for over six decades, an extraordinary achievement in any industry.

What Product is Right for Me?

Food Service Apparel
A variety of food safety apparel is available that is made of the highest quality materials to ensure your employees and customers are kept safe from food-borne illnesses.


Learn More
THE HANDGARDS DIFFERENCE

We are committed to the quality of our relationships with our customers, suppliers, community, and to each other. We are challenged to do our best and are empowered to accomplish the job at hand. As we work together we remember how past experience has helped us grow, but are not intimidated by what is new and untried. Through honest and open communication, we share knowledge and ideas for solving problems and making improvements. At Handgards we accept the challenge to grow our company and continue to be the recognized leader in our industry.

Online Tools & Resources

Handgards offers a number of helpful online tools and resources to help you find answers and information about our products and services. We want to provide proper education and training to our customers which will help them grow their business.

Core Values

Handgards follows fundamental core values which form the foundation on which we perform work and conduct ourselves. By abiding to these values and guiding principles this is what makes us who we are and is our fundamental driving force in our company culture.

Our People

At Handgards we believe our company is only as good as our people. Our people is the key ingredient to our success. Their loyalty and hard work is exemplified in the product we produce.They are committed to providing our customers quality product and service.​

Learn More
Learn More
Learn More
MANUFACTURING

Our manufacturing and distribution facilities are located in El Paso, Texas, in the Southwest region of the United States.

To insure high-quality products and a commitment to food safety, we have met all of the requirements to be an SQF (Safe Food Quality) certified facility.

More Info
DISTRIBUTION

With our customers in mind and always maintaining our goal of 100% on time and complete, we have expanded our distribution capabilities to Columbus, Ohio.

Delivering your product efficiently and on-time is of the utmost importance, we strive to meet your expectations.

More Info
Handgards University

Handgards University is not an actual university, college, or learning institution, it is an extension of Handgards’ commitment to provide tools and resources for our customers and sales network. HGU will be your one stop shop for educational, informational, and training needs. We have enhanced and streamlined the delivery of our marketing material content to insure that the features and benefits of our products are well represented.

The Handgards University team will be working diligently behind the scenes to gather and deliver content on a consistent basis to make your visit more productive, efficient, and enjoyable.

Full access to Handgards University is exclusive only to Handgards personnel, customers, and broker representatives.

Please contact your Handgards sales representative for access.

At nora systems, we have made a name for ourselves as floor covering manufacturer using rubber as an outstandingly resilient material. Since 1950 we have stood for top quality and the best possible service. In recent years, nora systems has optimized the manufacture and revolutionised the installation of floor coverings with the introduction of the innovative quick installation system nTx by using self-adhesive rubber flooring.

About

nora systems GmbH develops, produces and markets resilient rubber floors under the brand name nora. Headquartered in Weinheim, Germany, nora has been shaping the development of rubber floor coverings for over 60 years as a leading manufacturer worldwide.

nora recognizes its social responsibility toward the environment and its commitment to sustainability. For years, the company has given environmental stewardship the same priority as all other company objectives as it makes and sells products that are as ecologically compatible as possible in terms of content, manufacturing, use and disposal.

GEARED TOWARDS EXCELLENCE

Polymer Industries is a world leader in the manufacturing of polyolefins, engineering plastics, and high performance plastics. We produce stock shapes of sheet and rod and ship our products all over the US and throughout the world. Due to the capabilities of our multiple production facilities, we offer one of the broadest product portfolios in the performance plastics industry. This allows us to offer our customers everything from stock shapes to specialty products such as hurricane panels and truck liners. While we have a global presence and reputation of excellence, we are a family owned and operated business. Since 1975 we have remained committed to providing not only the best products in our industry, but the best service to our customers as well.

Core activities

Serving with
the power of PET

PET solutions that are good for products, people and for our planet

What we stand for

Resilux is a flexible and dynamic partner, down to earth and easy to work with.
Above all, we share our clients’ concerns for everyone’s wellbeing and for the planet. That’s why we are so passionate about collecting, reusing and recycling. And that’s what makes us different.

Our PET solutions

We understand the vital role packaging plays in helping you meet your business objectives. Whether for carbonated beverages, still drinks or non-food products we are ready to find the best solution for you. Producing PET (polyethylene terephthalate) preforms and bottles has been our core business since Resilux was founded.

Our products 

Resilux & sustainabilty

Resilux produces preforms made of PET (polyethylene terephthalate). This versatile material is easy to recycle and often comes back in the form of fibre for clothing and synthetic fabrics, foils and packaging. Increasingly, it is also recycled back to PET bottles once again.  

Core activities 

The Resilux Group continues expansion of recycling capability 

Resilux Central Europe Packaging Kft. and Resilux acquires a 70% share in Greentech Serbia and Macedonia recycling activities.

Read more 

We love people, 
our planet and the products we package

Consumers around the world are demanding more sustainable packaging for the food and non-food products they purchase. We have risen to this challenge by providing PET solutions that are good for people, our planet and the products.

ABOUT SEAWAY

Seaway Plastics Engineering along with its two divisions, MME Group and Wright Engineered Plastics, is a contract manufacturer that specializes in plastic injection molding for low to higher volume projects. For more than 40 years, the company has manufactured precision parts and created complex assemblies for customers across a range of highly regulated industries, including the medical, aerospace, defense and precision industrial markets.

Qualified as an ISO 13485 certified injection molder, Seaway provides medical injection molding, cleanroom injection molding and industrial injection molding. The company offers more than 700 industrial and medical-grade thermoplastics and liquid silicone rubber (LSR) to meet the needs of any customer.

Seaway provides a full range of services to ensure end-to-end support for its customers. Full turn-key solutions include design for manufacturing (DFM), engineering, in-house tool design and build, injection molding using thermoplastics and silicone, assembly, kitting, packaging, and distribution. The company also offers an array of value-added secondary operations, such as pad printing, welding, shielding, heat staking, annealing, and much more.

Partnering with Seaway provides cost and time savings and overall efficiency for every project due to their vertical integration. This translates to reduced overall risk and faster time to market.

The company has more than 250,000 square feet of manufacturing space at five facilities across the U.S.:

Port Richey, Florida

Brooksville, Florida

Santa Rosa, California

St. Paul, Minnesota (2)

All five Seaway locations are ISO 13485 certified to ensure the safe, reliable manufacturing and handling of medical devices.

With more than 25,000 square feet of ISO Class 7 & 8 cleanroom space, Seaway provides FDA-certified cleanroom injection molding and assembly. The company is equipped to manage not just the complex molding of individual parts, but any intricate mechanical and electrical assembly, validation and specialized packaging that are required to ensure the integrity of today’s specialized medical and healthcare-related products.

At Seaway, we bring an engineering mindset, world-class technologies and materials, end-to-end support, and a commitment to excellence to everything we do. Let us create customized injection molding solutions to meet your diverse and specialized manufacturing challenges.

Founded in 1975, Packaging Personified is a leader in the flexible packaging industry.
Our Story

In 1975, our founders Dominic Imburgia and Phyllis Muccianti sat at a kitchen table and created a flexible packaging business. After leaving Sears, they used their packaging experience to coordinate and procure flexible packaging for third-party use. As entrepreneurs, and firm believers in quality and service, they began their business at that same kitchen table. Within four months, their business needed more room to grow.

Learn More
Capabilities

Since our founding in 1975 our capabilities have expanded each year. Our goal of vertical integration has provided us with the ability to better manage quality, service and cost relative to our competitors.

Learn More
Products

Packaging Personified serves industry leaders with our flexible packaging, graphics proofing and separation, extrusion, printing, converting, lamination, and laser perforation, all done from our multiple manufacturing locations in the center of the United States. Our custom packaging has continuously proven, over decades, to be superior in quality and price. By working directly with our clients, we understand your specific needs and expectations. Whether large or small, we have the flexibility to handle your packaging needs.

PREFERRED BUYER OF MANUFACTURING AND INDUSTRIAL BUSINESSES

Founded in 2012, Right Lane is a private investment firm focused on leveraged buyouts and recapitalizations of manufacturing and industrial businesses. Since 2018, we have been investing exclusively out of our affiliate Right Lane Industries LLC, an industrial holding company offering a stable home to lower middle market industrial businesses that have been orphaned inside larger companies, or that are undergoing a period of underperformance for which prior ownership or their creditors are not capable of addressing.





Our transactions - which often involve a heightened level of complexity - are designed to provide attractive solutions to sellers, whether they are large corporates seeking to divest a non-core division, or the owners and creditors of an underperforming business seeking liquidity or recovery. At the same time, we seek to create a stable and prudently capitalized environment from which our companies can grow into world class, competitive organizations. Our companies are operated by autonomous management teams who are heavily aligned with Right Lane, and who share significantly in the wealth creation of our investments.

ABOUT US
One of the leading PET Film Manufacturers

Polyplex Corporation Ltd. (Polyplex) has the seventh-largest capacity of polyester (PET) film globally.

Our polyester capabilities include both thin and thick PET film in a wide range of thickness and surface properties covering a spectrum of applications.

Our diversified business portfolio also includes BOPP, Blown PP/PE and CPP films produced in state-of-the-art plants with economic size. Integrated downstream capabilities of Metallizing, Holography, Silicone Coating, Offline Chemical Coating, Extrusion Coating and Transfer Metallized Paper deliver further value-added products.

We have a global presence, supplying to about 2675 customers in 85 countries across Europe, the Americas, the Indian sub-continent, Far East, Asia Pacific and the Middle East.

LEADERS IN CONTRACT BLOW MOLDING SINCE 1986
WESTERN INDUSTRIES PLASTIC PRODUCTS, LLC

We help companies large and small grow their product lines by providing development solutions in furniture, sporting goods, medical equipment, agriculture, lawn & garden, health & safety, material handling, and many more by utilizing the plastic blow molding process.

Learn More
Industry Leader in Contract Blow Molding
Western Industries Plastic Products LLC has been the go-to name in large part custom blow molding for over 38 years. We have an extensive selection of 15 lb. to 75 lb. accumulator head machines, with platen sizes up to 96”. Together our team has over 75+ years of combined engineering experience. We can service even the most complex requests in the 1-45lb part range for blow molded products.
We are more than customer-focused, we are truly customer driven. We encourage our customers to think of us as an extension of their own capabilities, and we provide whatever degree of service is required. From product design assistance and process improvement, with simple stand-alone blow molding to complete product assemblies; from shoot-and-ship directives to full supply chain management, we offer our customers comprehensive services and turnkey opportunities to achieve their specific project goals.
Discover EXACTLY how we do it by exploring our Capabilities!

Large Part Blow Molding
Western Industries uses state-of-the-art equipment and technology to produce complete products from concept to sale with unparalleled quality, accuracy, and repeatability. As a blow molding company, we offer custom blow molding expertise, building on the strength of our people, and their dedication to service and quality. 
Our blow molding facilities encompass 500,000 sq. ft. including specific areas dedicated to manufacturing, assembly, warehousing, and shipping. Our machine shop capabilities provide customers with a seamless and efficient process from concept to production capability.
We mold, finish and assemble a wide range of parts on 19 blow mold machines and continue to strategically add to our capabilities with new equipment as our customer’s needs grow.

ABOUT US

Who We Are

Silgan Specialty Packaging is a dynamic and innovative division of Silgan Holdings Inc., a global leader in rigid packaging solutions. With a commitment to excellence, Silgan Specialty Packaging is at the forefront of creating cutting-edge packaging solutions that cater to a wide range of industries.


From food and beverage to personal care and healthcare, Silgan Specialty Packaging offers a diverse portfolio of high-quality plastic containers, closures, and dispensing systems that not only preserve and protect products but also enhance the overall consumer experience.


Driven by a passion for innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction, Silgan Specialty Packaging collaborates closely with its clients to develop customized packaging solutions that meet the unique needs of each industry and product. Its team of experts combines creativity and technical expertise to deliver packaging solutions that not only meet industry standards but also set new benchmarks for quality and functionality.


With a global presence and a dedication to staying ahead of market trends, Silgan Specialty Packaging continues to shape the future of packaging, providing brands with the tools they need to stand out in today’s competitive marketplace. Whether it’s creating a secure closure for a new beverage product or designing a user-friendly dispensing system for a personal care item, Silgan Specialty Packaging is a trusted partner in bringing packaging visions to life.

LEARN MORE

OUR PRODUCTS

Changing The Way You Look at Plastic

With a deep-rooted commitment to excellence, we specialize in crafting high-quality plastic products that cater to diverse industries and applications. From packaging and automotive components to consumer goods and beyond, our extensive range of products is designed to meet your unique needs.

With cutting-edge technology, stringent quality control, and a passion for delivering exceptional results, we are your trusted partner in the world of plastic manufacturing.

Our single-serve custom cups offer cost-effective solutions that reduce waste, improve operations, and delight consumers. With superior barrier technology, X-CUP will keep coffee fresh and customers coming back for more.

The Söhnergroup becomes iwis mechatronics

Engineering, Products, Processes and Technologies - with iwis mechatronics as a Solution Partner, there is an intelligent solution for everything.

We are a specialist for high-precision plastic-metal components and modules and a leading production and development partner for automotive as well as non-automotive applications. In addition to battery contact systems for electric vehicles, iwis mechatronics also develops products for the renewable energy, medical technology and consumer goods sectors, among others.

About us

iwis mechatronics is an independent operating division of the iwis Group and is managed by the parent company iwis SE & Co. KG. 

 

The iwis SE & Co. KG. with headquarters in Munich (Germany) forms the strategic holding of the independent business divisions. The holding company is supported by the Supervisory Board, composed of representatives of the owner families, and the Advisory Board, composed of experts.

 

The Supervisory Board decides on all fundamental issues relating to iwis' corporate, development and product policies, as well as its financial and investment policies. The Supervisory Board is always led by the respective Chairman of the Advisory Board.

EMPLOYEES

LOCATIONS WORLDWIDE

TURNOVER (MIO.€)

INJECTIONS MOLDING MACHINES WORLDWIDE

Our Core Competences

Our range of services is sophisticated and includes the manufacturing of prototype tools, stack moulds, 3-plate tools, hot runner moulds and multi-component tools as well as tools for reel and rotor / stator overmoulding. We process all conventional unreinforced and reinforced technical plastics, high-performance plastics and refined metals.

Thanks to our state-of-the-art production technology, trade skills and many years of experience in a wide range of technologies, our customers can trust our specialist competence which focuses on optimal economic system solutions. This is both the root of innovative technology and the basis of new products..

Product Development

In a setting of ever-shortening product cycles and reduced development times, we offer complete design for integration into customer geometries together with plastic-appropriate design of individual components and assembly groups. This way, we guarantee that our many years of experience in processing all conventional high-performance plastics are incorporated into every individual piece, from the very first development steps.

Our specialists optimize the diverse manufacturing steps processes for quality and cost-effectiveness already in the early stages of development and the results are incorporated directly into the product or process design.

Together with a selection of materials tailored to the requirements of each individual function, high-quality and economical products are created. Safe processes specifically adapted to the product requirements generate consistent quality and guarantee high economic efficiency

Tool and Automation Technology
Injection Moulding Tools
Bending, Stamping & Cutting Tools
Assembly and Test Equipment

Our knowledge from decades of experience in the manufacturing of stamping and injection moulding tools is a decisive component for our and your success. By complementing it with state-of-the-art technology, knowledge, skills and professional ability are consolidated in our in-house toolshop in order to develop tools.

Our focus lies on the automation technology of assembly units mwith the development, test cycles and production of individual components (hydraulics, pneumatics, electrics, mechatronics). The degree of automation in our production facilities with integrated injection moulding machinery and tools is still being constantly expanded today. Quality advantages and cost-conscious production are at the focus of functional process technology.

Your privacy settings
We and our partners use information collected through cookies and similar technologies to improve your experience on our site, analyse how you use it and for marketing purposes. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. In some cases, data obtained from cookies is shared with third parties for analytics or marketing reasons. You can exercise your right to opt-out of that sharing at any time by disabling cookies.

Necessary
Always ON
These cookies and scripts are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, suchas setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block oralert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do notstore any personally identifiable information.
Analytics
These cookies and scripts allow us to count visits and traffic sources, so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies and scripts, we will not know when you have visited our site.
Embedded Videos
These cookies and scripts may be set through our site by external video hosting services likeYouTube or Vimeo. They may be used to deliver video content on our website. It’s possible for the video provider to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on this or other websites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies or scripts it is possible that embedded video will not function as expected.
Google Fonts
Google Fonts is a font embedding service library. Google Fonts are stored on Google's CDN. The Google Fonts API is designed to limit the collection, storage, and use of end-user data to only what is needed to serve fonts efficiently. Use of Google Fonts API is unauthenticated. No cookies are sent by website visitors to the Google Fonts API. Requests to the Google Fonts API are made to resource-specific domains, such as fonts.googleapis.com or fonts.gstatic.com. This means your font requests are separate from and don't contain any credentials you send to google.com while using other Google services that are authenticated, such as Gmail.
Marketing
These cookies and scripts may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies and scripts, you will experience less targeted advertising.
Facebook Advanced Matching
Facebook Advanced Matching can improve ads attribution and conversion tracking. It can help us reach better-targeted custom audiences through our ads. When possible, we will share with Facebook hashed information like your name, phone, email, or address.
Facebook CAPI
Facebook Conversion API Events (CAPI) help us better understand how you interact with our websites. They allow us to measure the impact of our ads on the website's conversions and they improve ads targeting through custom audiences. When possible, we might share with Facebook information like name, email, phone, address.

THERMOFORMING

Allied Plastics is a full service custom plastic thermoformer specializing in medium to heavy gauge quality thermoplastic parts with quick turnarounds. We supply custom single sheet, twin sheet and pressure formed plastic products to a wide variety of OEM companies.

LEARN
PLASTIC SHEET EXTRUSION

To support our thermforming process, Allied Plastics also offers in-house plastic sheet extrusion in material types such as HMWPE, HDPE, TPO, ABS, and Styrene. We can produce sheet sizes up to 120” wide and .550” thick in smooth, haircell, or levant textures.

LEARN
INDUSTRIAL PACKAGING

Allied Plastics are experts in high quality Vacuum Formed and Twin Sheet reusable/returnable Industrial Packaging and Dunnage. Our accomplished, knowledgeable staff has experience in virtually every material-handling situation. Our engineers can take your part, prints or CAD files and design a custom Vacuum Formed Plastic reusable packaging tray, lid, or pallet that will protect your parts.

LEARN
FINISHING & ASSEMBLY

If your thermoformed part needs hardware installed, adhesives added, or parts assembled, our highly skilled production team can integrate these items before shipment.

Cost-effective products & services Customized for your specific needs

For over twenty years, Republic Plastics has been manufacturing and delivering a full range of custom and private label polystyrene foam tableware products, including plates, bowls, trays, hinged-lid take out food containers (also known as “clamshell” containers), and more. We have products ranging from our cost-effective value line to our high-quality institutional line, enabling us to serve virtually any level of need. With turnkey services, we can provide the private label products you need, packaged with unique graphics customized to meet your requirements, and ship to anywhere in the U.S. both quickly and reliably.

About Us
Sustainability Caring for both our customers & the environment

While many people believe that polystyrene – commonly known as Styrofoam – is not recyclable, it is, in fact, a recyclable material. When produced correctly, polystyrene also offers significant environmental advantages over other materials in terms of energy consumption, emissions, and waterborne waste. Learn more about Republic Plastics’ sustainable business practices and how we are doing our part to help the environment.

Sustainability
 
Our Customer Service Promise Integrity. Trust. Professionalism.

Republic Plastics goes above and beyond in manufacturing custom and private label foam food containers and tableware – we add real value to each customer experience through expert consulting that builds trusted partnerships. We strive to be as responsive as possible, exceed expectations, and act with integrity at all times. Learn more about our commitment to excellent customer service below.

Customer Service

Republic Plastics is one of the leading manufacturers of custom and private-label polystyrene dinnerware and tableware, including foam food containers, trays, plates, bowls, and much more, serving customers nationwide and in Canada and Mexico. With strategic geographic locations nationwide, Republic Plastics ships products quickly and reliably throughout North America.

We've partnered with Curry Brand.
Sport Court has partnered with Curry Brand to build a safe place for kids to grow, learn and have access to sport in Oakland. Together we can Change The Game For Good.
 
 
 
CHAMPIONSHIP-TESTED.

For over 50 years, Sport Court has been helping you build champions on a backyard court or on gymnasium flooring. Our CourtBuilders™ work with families and facilities across the nation and the globe to deliver high-caliber sports flooring that bring out the game in all of us. What we deliver for families and communities is the result of hard work, sweat, and pure skill. Sport Court is dedicated to providing lasting, safe, quality courts that create memories and foster talent.

MORE ABOUT US
VIEW GALLERY
 
 
EXPERIENCE THE
NEXT LEVEL.

Whether you’re looking for a multi-sport playground, basketball training ground, or volleyball center, we know it’s an investment in a future of fostering dedication and commitment. We’ve found there’s nothing quite like the look of a well done court or the squeak a shoe makes. So reach out to your local, certified CourtBuilder to schedule a time to experience the Sport Court® quality yourself. 

FIND A COURT BUILDER NEAR YOU
 
 
OUR PARTNERS.

We believe in team building. That’s why we’ve gathered an all-star squad of great partners. Sport Court is proud to be the official court of great sports organizations like the NCAA®, USA Volleyball, FIBA, and USA Volleyball as well as community clubs and teams across the nation.

 
 

Sport Court is an Official Supplier for:

 
 
Cooperative Purchasing with Sourcewell

Since 2014, Sport Court has been an Awarded Vendor with Sourcewell, a cooperative-purchasing public entity based in Staples, MN.  Sourcewell uses a comprehensive RFP process to select its approved vendors, thereby satisfying the open-bid, competitive purchasing requirements common to most public and governmental entities, schools, non-profits, and a variety of other organizations.

SUSTAINABILITY

As a leading plastic packaging manufacturer, PINNPACK strives for sustainability. That is why we use recycled plastic in our packaging in addition to being created with material that is recyclable itself!

Learn More
WHAT WE DO
EXTRUDE

The First step in our process is called EXTRUSION, where we take pellets and flake of PET/rPET plastic and turn it into large rolls of plastic sheet that we then Thermoform into product.

Learn More
THERMOFORM

Once we extrude the pellets/flake into Sheet Rolls. We then take those Sheet Rolls and THERMOFORM them into a variety of different product sizes and shapes

This durable yet lightweight material is made from Carbon, Oxygen, and Hydrogen. It is non-toxic and the most recyclable plastic material. PET can be recycled into rPET (Recycled PET) over and over again!

DESIGN CUSTOM INJECTION MOLDS AND PRECISION PLASTICS WITH TOTAL QUALITY, RELIABILITY, AND CONSISTENCY
CUSTOM INJECTION MOLDS

 - 2019 Plastics News Processor of the Year -

Intertech Plastics creates custom injection molds and precision plastics to deliver zero-defect solutions for medical, industrial, and consumer parts and packaging. Based in Denver, Colorado, we combine more than 40 years of award-winning molding experience with advanced manufacturing innovations.

ENGINEERING INJECTION MOLD PROTOTYPES

Intertech is an award winning injection molder and is reshaping the molding industry by solving today’s problems with tomorrow’s technology.  We challenge success upfront with P/FMEAs and DFMs during part and tooling development.  We utilize process controls and automated quality compliance systems to ensure we always hit the mark. Additionally, our fully automated production lines are monitored by innovative vision systems that ensure every part makes the grade, down to the millionth of an inch. Simply put, we have the tools that deliver.

EFFICIENT AUTOMATION WITH PLASTIC MOLDING TECHNOLOGY

Intertech is a world-class manufacturer investing in the right talent, technology and processes to deliver solutions that focus on defect prevention, sustainability, consistency and repeatability. Our talented and passionate team drives continuous improvement and innovation at all levels, allowing us to deliver molded products across a number of industries, including medical packaging, consumer goods and industrial products.

INNOVATION

At Intertech, our culture of innovation drives our quality. It’s every team member’s responsibility to ensure product quality, which starts at the beginning of a project. By utilizing a comprehensive process control system – including standard validation process, real-time process controls and in-process control technology – we are better able to control quality compliance.

QUALITY

We differentiate ourselves through our “Part Perfect” commitment. For our customers, this means that satisfaction is the top priority and we strive to build trust and confidence by delivering results. In other words, good enough simply isn’t good enough. Intertech’s commitment to quality means every part will be perfect.

What We Do

LPS Industries is a leader in the flexible packaging industry. For the past 60 years, LPS has been providing unique flexible packaging solutions to a variety of markets, including medical, food, electronics, agri-chemical and more.

FLEXIBLE PACKAGING

LPS takes pride in its rigorous quality control procedures that ensure its pressure sensitive adhesive coated products and pressure sensitive envelopes are always manufactured to the highest standards.

PRESSURE SENSITIVE ENVELOPES

A leading provider of hazardous material packaging solutions around the world, LPS Industries is committed to helping you find a cost effective and fully compliant solution to your Hazmat packaging and shipping requirements.

HAZMAT PACKAGING

From shipping boxes and packaging tape to placards and cushioning materials, LPS Industries has an expansive inventory of packaging materials and shipping systems to help.

SHIPPING MATERIALS
The Clean Room

The advanced state-of-the-art equipment technology gives greater control of the production environment. The cleanroom has a high exchange HEPA air filtration for superior dust and contamination control as well as HVAC equipment and controllers to ensure consistent temperature and humidity.

​

In addition, the cleanroom has enclosed sanitation and employee personal protection equipment. All dedicated production equipment follows SQF Edition 9 guidelines. All materials are FDA compliant.

​

The cleanroom certification of Class 100,000 (also known as ISO 8 cleanrooms) means the LPS Industries’ cleanroom has a maximum particle count of 100,000 particles greater than 0.5 microns per cubic foot of interior air. This level of cleanroom is used in biotechnology, pharmaceutical processes, and electronic assembly. In addition to the food packaging of LPS Industries, cleanrooms are also used in medical device assembly, lithium-ion battery production and solar panel production.

Flexible Packaging Engineered to Protect Your Product from its Environment.

LPS Industries is a 100% U.S. based, vertically-integrated flexible packaging manufacturer and converter. We are ISO 9001 and Cleanroom certified offering stock products and custom designed solutions for all your packaging needs.

Serving customers is ingrained in our culture. From design and engineering to manufacturing and fabrication to assembly and logistics, our experienced team can help you solve your building and manufacturing challenges quickly and cost-effectively.

BUILT TO LAST

When you use Bedford FRP materials, you’ll meet the immediate needs of your project. You’ll also get great value over the long term, because — unlike wood and metal — our materials hold up under even the harshest conditions.

WHY FRP

Facilities, safety and manufacturing professionals minimize maintenance costs and safety concerns by using Bedford’s fiberglass-reinforced plastic (FRP) products. FRP gratings, profiles and structures are long-lasting, strong yet lightweight, corrosion resistant, fire retardant, and have low conductivity. FRP will not shrink, swell, warp, dent or bow. It is available with anti-slip coating for worker safety, and is easy to fabricate and install with standard tools.

LEARN MORE ABOUT FRP

BEDFORD IN ACTION

Bedford solutions are in use where you might expect them — cooling towers, manufacturing, marine, mining, utilities, water treatment and many other industrial applications. But they’re also in places that may not come immediately to mind, such as aquariums, theme parks, pedestrian bridges and more. Check out these projects and more to see Bedford FRP products for a wide variety of customers.

ABOUT BEDFORD REINFORCED PLASTICS

Bedford offers an extensive line of FRP products and services. We use a pultrusion process to form fiberglass-reinforced polymer, or FRP, into a strong but lightweight profile that won’t corrode, rot, rust or warp. FRP grating and materials are used in a wide variety of applications ranging from industrial platforms, walkways and FRP stair towers to architectural projects, cooling towers, FRP pedestrian bridges, water treatment facilities and much more.

A Shared Quality Commitment: Bedford & OSCO Safety

Bedford’s partnership with OSCO Safety designates OSCO as the sole provider of ReadySeries modular products, reflecting their shared commitment to American manufacturing excellence and customer service.

OSCO offers diverse safety solutions and exceptional service, including dedicated project management. Reach out to our team for more information, request a quote or call 814-623-8125 to discuss the details of your project.

BUILDING THE WORLD TO LAST®
BUILDING A CREATIVE, MORE INNOVATIVE WORLD.

Our wide range of lightweight FRP products gives you the flexibility to create safe and innovative solutions without the limitations of traditional materials such as steel, wood or concrete.

See Solutions for a Creative World >
BUILDING A SAFER, MORE DURABLE WORLD.

Our grating, railing and structural products are designed for challenging environments, providing solutions that meet your safety and budget requirements.

See Solutions for a Safer World >
BUILDING A COST EFFECTIVE, MORE EFFICIENT WORLD.

Lighter and easier to install than steel, our products require less maintenance and last longer in even the harshest conditions. We deliver proven solutions with a lower life-cycle cost.

See Solutions for an Efficient World >




WHY CHOOSE FIBERGLASS REINFORCED PLASTIC (FRP) INSTEAD OF STEEL?

Contractors and architects prefer FRP over metal, wood and concrete for many industrial and construction applications. The benefits of building with FRP:

FRP is 70% lighter than steel with an exceptional strength-to-weight ratio.

FRP is corrosion resistant and requires less maintenance than traditional metal, wood and concrete products.

FRP is non-conductive and slip resistant, providing a safer alternative to steel and concrete.

We manufacture and fabricate FRP in a range of colors and shapes, giving architects options for creating compelling structures.

The Thompson Creek Experience

We offer more by design. From consultation to installation to service, our process is built around your needs.

1
Customize Your Project

Everything we offer is made with quality materials and fully customized to your home. Start your project with a custom quote, or request a design consultation if you’re not sure where to begin.

2
We’ll Make It Real

We provide a superior installation. Our crews are thorough and respectful of your home, and our Project Coordinators are available through every step of the process.

3
You’ll Enjoy It For Decades

We’re confident our products and installations will serve you and your family well. If there’s an issue, our warranty provides coverage for up to 50 years, and service is just a call away.

About Total Plastic Solutions

Centrally located in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia, TPS has been a premier molder of custom injection molded plastic components since 1997 in Lynchburg, Virginia. Serving the industry leaders in the medical, automotive, aerospace, military and consumer products markets, TPS excels in bringing the most challenging and innovative part designs from concept to reality.

Learn More
What We Believe

The fundamental philosophy of TPS has always been to set ourselves apart through excellent customer service, superior quality, on-time delivery and competitive pricing. We understand our customers often need input on part design including design for manufacturing, design for automation and opportunity for cost recovery early in the project’s life.

Mar-Bal’s material engineering team can customize a material to fit your application and meet your exact specifications. Bulk Molding Compounds (or BMC) are formulated to meet a range of application requirements, including:

High Aesthetic Appearance

Resistant to Harsh Chemicals and Stains

 

Electrical Properties

 

Sound Dampening

 

Environmental and Corrosion Resistance

 

Superior Physical and Mechanical Properties

 

Excellent Strength to Weight Ratio, High Impact Strength, Good Flexural Modulus

 

Tensile Strength, Very High Compression Strength

 

Flame Resistance and Non-Melting

Electrical Standoff Insulators by Mar-Bal

Mar-Bal, Inc. is the largest manufacturer of BMC molded Standoff Insulators in North America with the industry’s two leading brands: Glastic and Mar-Bal. Our UL listed Standoff Insulators are molded from a flame-retardant and track-resistant glass, reinforced thermoset polysester molding compound recognized for current carrying devices by UL. These shatter resistant insulators meet the most exacting standards for a variety of applications.

Standoff Insulators

SMALL PLANT FOCUS, BIG COMPANY RESOURCES

National Manufacturing Group, formally known as National Composites, is a multi-plant OEM supplier of custom molded FRP, Thermoformed plastic, and full metal cab fabrications and assembly. National Manufacturing Group utilizes multiple FRP molding methods including open mold, LRTM, RTM, and compression molding. National offers the convenience, engagement, and focus of small production facilities with the resources of a large organization.  We can assist on metal and composite product design (as needed), pattern build in house, R&D and prototyping, tool and fixture build in house, volume and product diversity with our multitude of molding capabilities, and class A paint capabilities.  Additionally, National is a full assembly group dedicated to value-add component installation and assembly.

National operates over 700,000 square feet of production space that spans six plants, four states and two countries. Our production facilities serve as individual entities but with the shared resources of business development, design, engineering, finance, and executive management. This approach ensures that our customers have advanced support from design, prototype, and material selection stage to full scale production. Whether the initiative is a one part production or tens of thousands, National possesses the diverse facilities and processes to handle any size program.







National’s unique approach to the market allows us to be versatile and agile in the markets that we serve. The diverse and ever expanding needs of these industries requires that National continues to grow and evolve with the world around us. At National Manufacturing Group we strive to deliver more than just quality products, we are dedicated to being a true partner with people you can rely on.

With Custom Soft Goods Manufacturing

At Vinyl Technology, we apply our vast experience in RF welding and custom industrial sewing services to manufacture custom made soft goods across industries. Our dielectric sealing and custom industrial sewing customers choose us for their soft goods manufacturing because, above all, we deliver quality products that are both safe and reliable.




In addition, our soft goods manufacturing processes require little or no tooling which may significantly reduce lead times and keep prices low. If you are looking for custom RF welding and RF sealing services in the USA, please contact us today.

Our Expertise

Our experience in soft goods manufacturing is your advantage. As the leading soft goods manufacturer in the USA, Vinyl Technology has long standing significant partners in key industries that have relied on us since 1981 to build their high performance mission critical products.




When you work with our experienced custom soft goods design team, you will quickly see that we specialize in creating high-quality soft goods products that are tailored to meet your unique requirements. From carrying cases for delicate medical equipment to cargo bags and bladders, our expertise lies in bringing your vision to life. Each product is crafted with care, ensuring the highest level of functionality and durability. We have the capacity, expertise, and experience to produce some of the most reliable American made products in the world. Experience the difference of working with our skilled designers and craftsmen for all your custom soft goods needs.




Vinyl Technology excels in soft goods manufacturing in the USA, offering custom solutions in textile and polymer film products since 1981. TCI is proud to be the only supplier to offer PFA, FEP, ETFE, PVDF, ECTFE, cast PTFE films, and 100% PTFE CrossFilm™

Textiles Coated International (TCI) has proven itself to be first in fluoropolymer capabilities after 30 plus years of manufacturing high-performance fluoropolymer films, laminates, and composites. Our high-quality fluoropolymer materials continuously perform in the most challenging thermal and chemical environments worldwide.

TCI produces fabrics for a variety of industries including architectural/greenhouse films, composite process materials, removable insulation jacket materials, tank liners, secondary containment, radome covers, floating roof seal materials, PTFE flexible ducting, and PTFE food belting. TCI is the world’s leading manufacturer of high-performance PTFE materials for non-metallic expansion joint manufacturers. Our superior material quality allows manufacturers to engineer successful long-term solutions for fabric expansion joints, while TCI helps our customers to remain on the forefront of new technologies for non-metallic expansion joints.

As the PTFE experts, TCI has decades of experience helping customers understand the effectiveness of PTFE barrier materials. TCI produces a range of specialty textiles such as our 100% PTFE CrossFilm™, a variety of PTFE-coated fiberglass fabrics, and other materials designed for optimal performance in challenging applications.

ABOUT PSI
Strategy-led design in every detail

Located in Central Texas, just north of Austin, Panel Specialists, Inc. (PSI) is a manufacturer of custom wall panels, partitions, furniture, and wall systems. We offer a wide variety of architectural and interior design products to meet the needs of schools, hospitals, clinics, recreational centers, airports, offshore rigs + vessels, retail, and commercial interiors across the United States.

We remain rich in accolades for the wonderful products delivered since 1990, but it is our people who truly make a difference. At PSI we help our customers execute their vision by delivering quality products, on-time and within budget, all while providing excellent customer service along the way. 

ABOUT PANEL SPECIALISTS, INC.

Industry leaders trust PSI
Gayla Lutts, Ed.D.
Superintendent/CEO, Canadian Valley Technology Center

Panel Specialists, Inc. (PSI) worked with our architect, MA+, in 2012 to design and install a wall panel system in our Health Careers building at our Chickasha campus. The panel system has held up well since the building was reopened during the 2014-15 school year. It is easy to maintain and we have had no maintenance issues or other concerns. Additionally, the panels have been an attractive addition to the building; they brighten up the lobby area making it inviting and vibrant!

Stephanie Laughlin, RID, IIDA
Sr. Project Interior Designer

We recently used PSI wall panel systems for the first time last summer. Several of our residence halls are over 50 years old and it shows. We used the panel system to cover up the old walls in the entire Lobby of Wall Gates. It completely transformed the lobby and it looks brand new! It is a very durable, easy to clean, cost effective wall treatment. I like that you can create your own designs by using different laminates and tackable surfaces. They sent out representatives to measure and help out with the logistics of this large renovation. The panels come pre-cut and numbered so the installation will go smoothly. They are also available for questions or situations that may arise. We appreciate your help and expertise!

Randy Salsman
Senior Construction Project Manager, Facilities Maintenance, University of North Texas

We have recently renovated our 60+ year old Physics Building and utilized the PSI wall panel system to overlay the existing tile wainscoting on the first-floor hallways. It dramatically transformed the building's interior with
amazing results. The quality and workmanship of the PSI panel system are exceptional. We installed this system in
one of our heavily used conference rooms 8 years ago and it still looks as good as when it was first installed. PSI Wall Systems is an excellent product which will serve you well for years to come.

Chris Harren
Austin Commercial, LP, Methodist Sugar Land Hospital

PSI has been easy to work with both in the field and in the office. Deliveries and installations were on time
leading to a successful completion of their scope of work and the project in general.

Duane Martin
Director of A/E Services, Hendrick Medical Center

Hendrick Medical Center has been using PSI’s laminate wainscot panels for the last 13 years. In an effort to provide finishes that could withstand a lot of abuse, cut down on maintenance costs and provide a nice look, we implemented laminate wainscot panels in all patient rooms. This has proven to be so beneficial that we have pushed this concept out to exam rooms and waiting rooms in many of our locations. In my opinion, that one finish upgrade has been one of our best decisions. The enhanced appearance, along with the extended life of our room finishes, gives our customers a great impression while also saving us money on maintenance. We have implemented this concept in areas that are the most difficult to keep looking good on a day-to-day basis. We are very proud of our “look” and PSI laminate wainscot panels are a big part of our success.

ABOUT KAYSUN
Capabilities

We are committed to using our depth of knowledge, engineering expertise, and highly specialized material selection insights to help our customers find innovative solutions to their most complex applications, across a variety of markets.



Why Partner With Kaysun?

When state-of-the-art technology meets world-class problem solving, challenges are overcome. Goals are achieved. Results create competitive advantage.

Our partners include Fortune 500 companies, and span across diverse markets. They’re different, yet the same — they all need trusted custom injection molding solutions for highly engineered, complex applications. And they rely on Kaysun’s expertise, passion, and guidance to deliver.

ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP
Kaysun successfully diverted over 2.7 million pounds of plastic waste from landfills

Sustainability isn’t a buzzword or a future focus at Kaysun. We’re actively pursuing opportunities to demonstrate it in meaningful, inspirational ways.

Whether it’s the simple act of tending the Kaysun employee garden or joining forces to reach a major landfill waste-diversion milestone, our team is in it together.

We owe it to our planet, our customers, and ourselves.

Employer of Choice

People are our greatest asset. The Kaysun culture is shaped by core values that support and empower team members to reach their full potentials personally and professionally.

Our environment of respect, integrity, and wellness is the framework for fulfilling Kaysun careers. We invest in the whole person because we know it’s a difference-maker in the lives of our employees and their families.

Kaysun is proudly an employer of choice in our area and our industry. Join our team! Check out our available positions, great benefits, and apply online.

We are proud to announce that L.F. Manufacturing (LFM) was acquired by the Fiber Glass Systems business unit within NOV, Inc. in August 2022. Fiber Glass Systems is the leader in composite piping systems, fittings, tanks, and structures for the oil and gas, chemical and industrial, marine, offshore, fuel handling, and water industries. This acquisition provides many new and exciting opportunities within our markets. Since the acquisition, our day-to-day business has continued as usual and your current contacts remain the same. Combining expertise in manufacturing, knowledge of fiberglass/composites, and a passion to serve will allow us to remain the fiberglass/composites leader and continue to create the best product and service offerings for our customers.
Our Story
Check out LFM’s profile segment on the Fox Business Network’s Manufacturing Marvels®.
Markets We Serve

LFM provides the finest fiberglass tanks and vessels to service the Oilfield, Industrial, Water / Wastewater, Agricultural, and OEM markets.  Across all product lines, we deliver decades of dependability with every fiberglass product we sell.

Custom Solutions

We market our custom fiberglass products throughout the United States utilizing a network of retail distributors and independent representatives. We offer professional quotes and submittals along with courteous service. Once your fiberglass products have been manufactured, our transportation department will see that it gets to you on time and safely. Our drivers are professionals who understand the importance and demands of your schedule.

LEARN MORE
CUSTOM QUOTE NOW
Bul-Tuf®
LFM is the only manufacturer of the original Bul-Tuf® line of stock watering tanks. Accept no substitutes.
LEARN MORE
Corporate Divisions

Let us put our unmatched experience to work for you. LFM has been building fiberglass reinforced plastic tanks and process vessels for a wide range of applications since 1974. We utilize the latest in chop and filament winding equipment available in the industry today, thus supplying our customers with the highest quality fiberglass structures on the market. Our 83,000 square feet production facility is situated on 35 acres just east of Giddings, Texas (50 miles east of Austin).

Oilfield

LFM creates fiberglass above-ground storage tanks for use in oilfields. Our oilfield products include storage tanks for crude oil production, for storage of produced water, and for salt-water disposal purposes.

Industrial

LFM’s industrial products include above- and below-ground storage tanks for agricultural use, fire suppression, light chemical, and a wide variety of other uses, such as sumps, ducting and piping.

Chemical

Our fiberglass chemical tanks and process vessels are fabricated to the highest standards appropriate to the corrosive environments in which they are used. Most are designed to the ASME RTP-1 standard.

Environmental

LFM’s environmental products are corrosion resistant, and include manholes, liners, wetwells, potable water tanks, rainwater tanks, and chemical tanks for use in water and wastewater treatment.

Giddings, Texas-based LF Manufacturing (LFM) is proud to announce that the company’s Bul-TufTM line of fiberglass livestock and wildlife watering tanks has received approval for statewide use from the Texas Natural Resource Conservation Services (NRCS) of the US Department of Agriculture (USDA).  Following an application and review process by the state, LFM’s Bul-TufTM troughs and…

About LFM

L.F. Manufacturing, Inc. (LFM), headquartered in Giddings, Texas, has been a major manufacturer of fiberglass-reinforced polymer (FRP) structures since 1974. LFM currently has six manufacturing facilities across the U.S. to service every region in the country. With over 200 employees, LFM manufactures pipe and structures in diameters from 8-inches to 20-feet and heights in access of 40-feet. Our fiberglass manufacturing processes include the latest chop-hoop and helical filament winding, open-mold spray-up, resin transfer molding and vacuum assist methods. For our OEM customers, LFM production services include plug and mold making to aid in product design, development and production.

We are an Essential Partner to the World’s Best Brands

Lean on Sussex IM to be your plastic injection molding experts – focused on delivering high-quality plastic parts that arrive on time and exceed your expectations. Since 1977, Sussex IM is a proven, long-standing leader in mid to high-volume (100,000+) custom molding. We provide value to our customers through Design-for-Manufacturing and ISO certified capabilities for production molding with integrated value-added operations.

Your Single-Source Custom Injection Molder

Find the Services that Fit Your Application

DOWNLOAD OUR BROCHURE HERE

Diverse Injection Molding Experience Across Many Industries

With over 40 years of experience Sussex IM is a reliable injection molding supplier across various markets. Specializing in highly complex parts and utilizing both automation and post-molding applications, we offer knowledge and expertise in multiple industries. These industries include: consumer products, agriscience/garden, medical/pharma, residential durable and industrial.

Consumer Products

Agriscience / Garden

Medical / Pharma


Residential Durables

Industrial


Let Us Be the Injection Molding Expert – So You Don’t Have to Be.

At Sussex IM we offer our customers a wide range of services and molding applications that decrease costs and increase quality. Our diverse industry portfolio provides us with a unique ability to utilize molding techniques and applications across industries to best meet our customer’s needs. These services include multi-shot molding, IML/IMD, over molding, insert molding, and decoration. 

Injection Molding

Sussex IM runs over 65 injection molding machines – ranging from 25 to 725 tons and specializes in mid to high-volume production runs.

IML / IMD

In-molding labeling and In-mold decorating are an integrated part decorating technique wherein a decorative film, label or pre-form is placed into the mold prior to mold close and injection.

Multi-Shot Molding

Sussex IM is versed and experienced in the different tooling technologies associated with multi-shot molding.

Decoration

Given our experience in the Cosmetics market, we have the ability to decorate on a variety of substrates.

Insert Molding

Be it threaded or metal inserts, electrical contacts, RFID, fabric or injection molded forms, insert molding is a critical manufacturing technique.

Over Molding

We actively use a variety of techniques and part-design and tool-design styles to attain multi-color or multi-material offerings to our partners.

Quality Is Our Policy

Quality is the basis of our business here at FM Corporation. We make delivering quality products our first priority. To that aim, we are registered as an ISO 9001-2015 certified company. Safety, Cost, and Sustainability: The Balancing Act of Medical Device Packaging Part 2

Annnnd, we’re back with Part 2 of our medical device packaging series! In this edition, we’ll wrap up our list of top materials. And we’ll review the most important considerations as you engineer your medical device packaging. Let’s pick it back up with number five on our list  — trusty, cost-effective corrugated fiberboard Here goes! 5. Corrugated Fiberboard Advantages: Used primarily as secondary packaging, corrugated fiberboard adds a layer of cushioning and protection. It’s sturdy and can be easily customized to fit multiple devices, making it a reliable choice for bulk packaging within medical device logistics. Cost-Effectiveness: Fiberboard is one [...]

Safety, Cost, and Sustainability: The Balancing Act of Medical Device Packaging Part 1

When it comes to medical device packaging, finding the sweet spot between safety, cost, and sustainability is a juggling act. Medical packaging may need to preserve sterility, protect from contamination, and meet strict regulatory standards — all while keeping costs and damage low. Add environmental sustainability to the mix, and you’ve got Goldilocks’ porridge.  In this two-part series, we’ll explore the top packaging materials in the industry, examining their strengths, cost-effectiveness, and sustainability. Let’s dive right in! 1. Thermoformed Trays Advantages: Thermoformed trays are a popular choice for medical device packaging, known for their rigidity and precise fit. They provide an [...]

Prescription for Savings: Your Guide to Containing Costs on Medical Device Logistics

In medical device logistics, controlling costs is crucial. But safety and regulatory compliance can’t take a back seat. It’s a delicate balance to strike, especially when you’re dealing with intricate medical device packaging that must protect sterility and offer reliable delivery. With smart strategies, you can have your packaging cake without eating huge logistics costs.  Optimize Packaging Design for Efficiency Medical device packaging is more than just a container; it’s a critical component of your device's overall safety and integrity. Designing packaging that meets regulatory standards while minimizing materials can significantly reduce costs. Choose a packaging partner that can engineer [...]

DECARBONIZING GLOBAL TRANSPORT
A Better Future: Our Shift to Green

Safer. Smarter. Cleaner. Greener.

See how we are committed to sustainable transportation solutions
UP TO 30% FUEL & EMISSIONS SAVINGS
FLXdrive™ Battery Electric Locomotive

Over the last year, Wabtec took a bold step toward a low-to-zero-emission locomotive future with the world’s first heavy-haul 100-percent battery-electric locomotive – called FLXdrive™. The locomotive, powered by approximately 20,000 battery cells, was tested in revenue operation across more than 13,320 miles of hilly terrain in San Joaquin Valley, California.

Operating in a consist between two other locomotives and with a battery capacity of 2.4 megawatt hours, FLXdrive successfully reduced overall fuel consumption by more than 11 percent — the equivalent to over 6,200 gallons of diesel fuel saved and approximately 69 tons of CO2 emissions reduced.

The next version of FLXdrive is currently in development and expected to be ready for market in 2023. With a battery capacity of more than 7 megawatt hours, we anticipate further reducing fuel consumption and emissions by up to 30 percent.

Composites - The Material Of The Future
WATCH

WHAT WE DO

The Future Pipe Advantage

We set the standard in composite pipe solutions with an unmatched range of glass fiber products across diverse sectors. In an industry where not all non-metallic pipes are created equal, our commitment to quality ensures that every FPI product meets the highest international standards. Utilizing advanced glass fiber technology, our future-proof composite pipe solutions are cost-effective with a considerably lower carbon footprint, as well as offer superior corrosion resistance and longevity compared to traditional materials. With global presence and over four decades of expertise, we excel in innovative solutions that enable us to meet clients’ unique needs. Our proficiency in managing large, complex projects further distinguishes us as the partner of choice in the industry. With a focus on sustainability and environmental stewardship, our strategic R&D investments continue to ensure that we are always shaping the future of industry advancements.

Learn More

OUR TECHNOLOGY

We Produce High-Performance Pipes Through Advanced Winding Techniques

We leverage our expertise to customize solutions for diverse specifications and applications. Our continuous innovation and adaptation enable us to meet clients' specific needs with precision and efficiency.

Our Technology

OUR OPERATIONS

At A Glance

factories

13

customers

400+

countries

50+

Our state-of-the-art facilities feature advanced manufacturing, testing, and process control systems, driving 53 production lines across 681,000 m².

Our global presence fosters close partnerships with clients, cultivating strong relationships and enabling us to deliver unparalleled value through customized solutions.

Our operations span across the Middle East, Africa, Europe, North America, and Asia, with factories in 10 countries and 25 global offices.

THE FPI ADVANTAGE

Benefits Of Our Composite Piping Solutions

01

Durable And Lightweight

With a high strength-to-weight ratio, our solutions cut down on transportation and installation costs compared to steel or concrete.

Cost Effective And Efficient

Surpassing steel, ductile iron, and concrete in hydraulic performance, our solutions drastically reduce operating expenses. Plus, with shorter lead times and streamlined supply chains, they offer unmatched cost-effectiveness.

Sustainable

Composite pipes require low energy for production and feature a smooth interior surface, reducing the energy needed for fluid circulation. Our composite solutions also offer a significant reduction in carbon emissions compared to metal-based pipe. Due to the lighter weight of composite products, we demonstrate tangible reductions in each product's carbon footprint. This translates to lower Scope 3 emissions for our customers, aiding them in meeting their climate objectives.

Longer Life Cycle

Our pipes offer lasting durability, extending system life cycles well beyond traditional materials. With composites lasting over 50 years, they're a cost-effective solution.

Versatile And Accommodating

Our solutions offer flexible assembly options and handle high pressures, temperatures, loads, and chemical resistance with ease, allowing for complex configurations.

Anti-Corrosive And Resistant

Exceptionally resistant to corrosive environments, our composites endure soils, saltwater, H2S, and chemicals, ensuring pipes last longer.

OUR SECTORS

With Unparalleled Expertise, We Stand Out In Our Industry By Providing Composite Pipe Systems Across A Broad Range Of Applications And Sectors.
Energies
Energies

Both traditional and new energies are essential to driving the modern world. With the global demand for energy ever increasing, FPI plays a pivotal role in the delivery of new energy projects in a sustainable and efficient manner.

Industrial Plants
Industrial Plants

Industrial plants span a wide array of industries, each presenting unique opportunities, challenges, and requirements. A common thread across all sectors is the necessity to maximize uptime and profitability while prioritizing safety and minimizing environmental impact. FPI distinguishes itself by producing a diverse range of products, varying in materials, sizes, and pressure classes, which highlights its exceptional capability and capacity.

Marine
Marine

FPI products, renowned for their excellent corrosion resistance, are ideal for marine vessels, offering cost savings due to lower installation expenses, lightweight properties, and ease of handling. They are used in systems such as seawater cooling and heating, ballast, potable water, swimming pool lines, bilge, and scrubber piping. Additionally, FPI manufactures custom high-quality seawater intake filters. Our composite piping systems are implemented worldwide on various ships, including cruise ships, luxury yachts, tankers, bulk carriers, container vessels, naval ships, FPSOs, and FSRUs.

Offshore Platforms
Offshore Platforms

Offshore platforms are crucial components in energy supply chains, ensuring energy security through production and storage activities. They also play a significant role in addressing climate change via CO2 sequestration. Given the harsh marine environments they must endure, it is essential to use only the most durable materials to maximize reliability and safety. FPI's GRE-RTR products are an ideal choice for offshore applications. Due to their location, offshore platforms must withstand the full spectrum of challenges posed by nature.

Power Generation
Power Generation

The integration of conventional and new power generation systems is crucial for delivering a balanced and transitional approach, ensuring a stable and reliable energy supply. Promoting sustainability in energy sources and minimizing the environmental impact of construction are key areas where FPI is strategically positioned to lead.

Water & Infrastructure
Water & Infrastructure

Water and infrastructure projects are vital components of the built environment, playing a crucial role in societal development by providing clean water, sanitation, and climate resilience. FPI delivers bespoke solutions to tackle these challenges and reduce carbon footprints, ensuring a sustainable future in an evolving world.

OUR SOLUTIONS

Industry-Leading Expertise
Discover All Solutions
Manufacturing

With an impeccable track record of qualified products and adherence to international specifications, we consistently deliver on our promises, ensuring the highest quality performance and reliability.

Project Management

Future Pipe Industries specialise in navigating highly complex projects, seamlessly integrating innovation, reliability, and sustainability into every endeavour. 

Field Services

We ensure flawless installation by managing all project site activities. Our field assistance services include comprehensive training and bonder certification for your team.

Engineering Services

Future Pipe Industries offers optimized pipe systems design and engineering, including stress and surge analysis as well as pipe support packages and detailed engineering.

Reusable packaging containers

Good for business. Good for the planet.

Fed up with packaging solutions that don’t perform and are bad for our planet? Switch to our sustainable pooling and reusable packaging solutions to experience the difference. Based on the share-reuse-reduce model, our SmartCycle pooling system reduces waste, CO2 emissions and drives cost savings. Our wide range of reusable packaging containers (RPCs) meanwhile ensure your high-quality products stay fresh and retail-ready.

Make the Switch

A packaging solution for all your fresh grocery products

Your fresh grocery products deserve better protection and a longer shelf life. Our reusable packaging containers (RPCs) suit every type of fruit and vegetable (there’s even one specifically designed for bananas!) as well as meat, fish, eggs, baked goods, and deli and convenience items. Deliver the fresh food that consumers want.

The future of our planet is a circle

We’ve been championing the circular economy model for 30 years now – eliminating waste and maximizing value creation. We are constantly innovating in our quest for sustainability and circularity. Being at the leading edge means our partners get to experience the finest innovations and advances of our industry.

Join us in our movement to make the fresh grocery supply chain sustainable!

Packaging solutions to end single-use packaging once and for all

We believe in conducting business sustainably, and we count on our partners to do the same.

Valtir has been an industry leader and global supplier of highway safety products for over 50  years. Our core roadway product lines include guardrail, end terminals, cable and steel longitudinal barriers, crash cushions, truck and trailer-mounted attenuators, water-filled barricades, sign supports, and delineators.

Working with industry partners and safety experts, Valtir continues to bring the next generation of innovative safety products to a dynamically changing market. Our products are specified, sold, and installed throughout North America and in more than 100 international markets.

Made with Pride in the USA

Since 1962, every product TSE Industries has fabricated or manufactured has been made in sunny Clearwater, Florida.

	
TSE INDUSTRIES
A Passion for Polymers

TSE Industries is a global polymer manufacturer providing products and services that are made in America. At TSE, we have four core divisions within our company: the manufacturing of custom molded, injected, and extruded rubber components; the fabrication of plastics components; a contract manufacturer of specialty Coatings, Adhesives, Sealants, and Elastomers (CASE) including HMPURs, TDI, and MDI prepolymers; and the manufacturing of Millathane® millable polyurethane rubber, and Thanecure® and Thanecast® products.

We are guided daily by the guidelines found in our Quality Policy and the quality systems of TSE Industries, Inc. have been certified by DQS Inc. to the ISO 9001:2015 Standard.

TSE a Family of Businesses and Companies
Contract Manufacturer of Specialty CASE Products

We’ve toll manufactured over 300 million pounds of polyurethanes for our customers. Consistent and reliable, we deliver on-time and on-spec.

Millathane® Millable Polyurethane Rubber

Millathane® millable polyurethane for applications requiring superior abrasion resistance and mechanical strength as well as oil and ozone resistance.

Plastics Fabrication and Machining

Bring us your tightest tolerances and oddest profiles and our skilled fabrication engineers can machine parts to your exact specifications.

Single-Use Products & Medical Device Manufacturing

Leading experts in the single use process components and assemblies with biopharma, life science, and cell therapies in mind.

Ultra High Molecular Weight Polyethylene Sheets (UHMW-PE)

Over 20 years of technology advancements in polymer sheets, with solutions designed for conveyor industry, machine construction, and the food and beverage industry.

If it’s Polymer, It’s TSE!™

Since its inception in 1962, TSE Industries has been a family-owned and operated company that manufactures all of its products here in America. When Walter and Helen Klingel took their last $2,000 and started Technical Sales Company, they could not imagine what it would become.

What started out as a small “mom and pop” plastics distributor has now grown into a global manufacturer and fabricator of polymers and rubber lead by the 3rd generation. Here’s the story of how it all began.

Compression Molding

We provide compression and vacuum assist molding capabilities from small scale and prototyping to large scale production runs. We become your manufacturing partner to bring your product to market.

Large Capacity

Design

SMC Manufacturing

Automotive & Truck
