SAFEGUARD YOUR ASSET

Transform your space with Sunscape® premium architectural window films. Enjoy the benefits of advanced technology that ensures cooler summers, warmer winters, and reduced glare and UV exposure. Providing long-lasting comfort and protection, Madico's innovative films are designed to meet the diverse needs of both residential and commercial properties. Choose Sunscape for unparalleled performance and style.

 Reduces Energy Costs: Sunscape films dramatically reduce energy costs by rejecting heat in the summer and retaining it in the winter, increasing overall comfort.
 Blocks Harmful UV Rays: Eliminates more than 99% of harmful UV rays, preventing fading of furniture and posing fewer health risks to your family and guests.
 Minimizes Glare: Reduces annoying glare, making it easier to enjoy natural light without discomfort or eye strain.
 Natural Appearance: Features a natural, non-reflective appearance, preferred by interior designers worldwide for aesthetic enhancement.
 Lifetime Warranty: Sunscape films are warranted for as long as you own your home, ensuring long-term performance and protection.
DISCOVER SUNSCAPE

ProtectionPro provides advanced, on-demand screen and device protection for both consumers and potential retail or distributor partners. The ProtectionPro system offers a wide selection of cut-on-demand machines and quality films, enabling businesses to deliver custom solutions for various devices—from car navigation systems and phones to specialized screens in healthcare, automotive, and military sectors, enhancing their revenue streams while providing screen protection for all their customers. And with over 13,000 retail and repair stores globally offering ProtectionPro, consumers can find bespoke screen protection at many local retail or repair stores. The ProtectionPro platform is driven by the industry's state-of-the-art app, offering easy-to-use ways to provide coverage for over 48,000 screen designs with hundreds more added weekly.

 Expansive Design Database: ProtectionPro supports over 47,000 device patterns, including the latest models like the Samsung S24 series, with new designs added every week.
 Variety of Protection Options: Offers a selection of films such as Ultra2, Ultra Matte, Ultra HD, Omni, and Privacy films to suit different customer preferences and needs.
 Cut-On-Demand Technology: Our range of cut-on-demand machines allows for precise and tailored screen protection, eliminating the need for extensive inventory.
 Easy Application: Supports both wet and dry installation processes, ensuring a seamless application that enhances customer satisfaction.
 Global Reach: Currently serving over 13,000 retail and repair stores worldwide, ProtectionPro is designed to maximize profits and streamline inventory management for businesses
LEARN MORE

ViewScape by Madico introduces an innovative solution for transparent roof structures, offering unparalleled clarity, strength, and solar performance. Designed for long-span applications, ViewScape is perfect for stadiums, airports, concert venues, and cultural facilities, providing a versatile and robust alternative to traditional materials.

 Superior Strength: ViewScape is four times stronger than traditional ETFE, allowing for longer spans with fewer secondary support elements and no reinforcing cables.
 Customizable: Tailor ViewScape to meet specific thermal and aesthetic requirements, ensuring optimal performance for any project.
 Simplified Design: With fewer layers, cushions, and reinforcing cables, ViewScape reduces visual clutter and simplifies transportation, construction, and installation processes.
 Exceptional Clarity: The material offers high visibility without glare, enhancing the aesthetic appeal compared to fritted ETFE.
 Thermal Control: Integrated solar control features provide the benefits of both ETFE's clarity and the strength of conventional translucent building materials, optimizing energy performance.

A TRUSTED PARTNER FOR FLEXIBLE PACKAGING SOLUTIONS

ISOFlex Packaging is dedicated to finding solutions for the most challenging flexible packaging needs. We provide fresh ideas and effective approaches to create products to help our customers succeed.

Through our extensive film industry experience and forward-thinking approach, we find innovative ways to meet the critical needs of the laminating, printing, coating and converting markets. Our films serve a broad variety of end-use markets, including food and beverage, consumer products, industrial film and bags, agricultural products, medical and pharmaceutical and other innovative products.
At ISOFlex, our facilities are equipped with technologically advanced machinery and proven processes to manufacture specialty films that meet the critical needs of the laminating, printing, coating and converting markets.


STRENGTH IN NUMBERS

As part of the Sigma Plastics Group, the largest privately-owned film extrusion group in the U.S., Canada and Central America, ISOFlex Packaging operates seven facilities throughout the U.S. and has a total film and bag capacity of 350 million pounds.

PERFORMANCE PACKAGING

ISOFlex Packaging manufactures specialty plastic films and bags for shrink, barrier, laminating, coating, converting and can liners. We provide a variety of packaging solutions with precision and performance that match exact specifications and exceed expectations.

PRECISION & INNOVATION

Every challenge we address, every film we produce and every run on our film lines are opportunities to put our expertise and proven processes to the test while discovering new ways to make our processes and products better and more efficient.

SQF Food Safety Code for Manufacturing Certified

ISOFlex Packaging is registered as meeting the requirements of the SQF Quality Code for the Manufacture of Food Sector Packaging Materials, including Flexible Film, Flexible Packaging, Food Contact Packaging and Food-Grade Packing Materials.



Certified Minority Business Enterprise

The National Minority Supplier Development Council (NMSDC) has certified that our company has met the requirements for certification as a bona fide Minority Business Enterprise as defined and adopted by the South Carolina, North Carolina and Florida Minority Supplier Development Council.

SEARCH FOR:

Founded in 1898, Chomarat is an independent industrial group that has become a benchmark in the world of composite materials and technical textiles. It has three businesses that function in synergy – Composites Reinforcements, Construction Reinforcements, and Coatings & Films – Textiles – and it draws on an international organizational structure with four industrial sites in France, Tunisia, the United States and China.

The Group has a strong innovation strategy: it invests in new technologies and carries out research through academic and technical partnerships on all continents.

Chomarat™ offers a high level of technical expertise in the most innovative sectors, including the automotive, aeronautics, sports, energy, marine and construction industries, and also in markets demanding high standards, know-how and creativity, such as the luxury goods market.

Composites
Reinforcements
Reinforcements equal efficiency

Chomarat™ has a wide range of technologies to design and produce reinforcements for efficient and innovative composites. Woven fabric, multiaxial and sandwich reinforcements made from glass, aramid and carbon fiber.

Chomarat™ innovates in carbon reinforcements and opens up new prospects for lighter, more efficient composites for the automotive, sports and leisure, industrial and aeronautics sectors.

Construction
Reinforcements
When materials hold up…

In the construction field, Chomarat is an expert in grid technology, which combines textile and chemical know-how. The Group designs and manufactures products used for their effectiveness in reinforcing roads, structural works, façades, bituminous membranes and in plasterboard or cement board, and precast elements.

Coatings & Films - Textiles
The Chomarat™ “label” from cars to luxury goods

The Chomarat™ Group is a specialist in textile coatings for the automotive industry, luxury luggage, protective clothing and the industrial sector, and an expert in technical films for hot stamping. We combine efficiency, comfort and finishing for these demanding sectors.

Delivering on Our Word

Walking the Walk For Over 50 Years

Founded in Atlanta, Georgia by Frank Pritchard in 1972 as a manufacturer of protective packaging products, Pak-Lite, Inc. has embarked on a progressive path of product diversification and enhanced capabilities. Guiding them to the position of a leading North American converter/manufacturer of US-sourced foams, rubber, nonwovens, foils, films, and specialty materials. Our customer base includes many of the top OEM and industrial companies in the world.

Connect with Us
Why choose Pak-Lite, Inc? 
Because We Manufacture Success

PLI has manufacturing facilities in GA, NC, and Taiwan. We have over 300+ dedicated professionals committed to making your project a success before, during, and after the design and manufacturing of your product. We will help you select the best, sustainable materials for your specific application. Join our customer base, which already includes many of the top OEM and industrial companies in the world.

Why We're Different
Certified to Meet Your Manufacturing Needs
See Our Certifications
Global
Manufacturing Capabilities

Our manufacturing capabilities include extrusion lamination to foams and rubber substrates. We combine materials to composite form and then supply you with die-cut parts, components, roll stock, or sheeting. Finished parts often include pressure-sensitive adhesives and release liners. Additional capabilities include material selection, prototyping, skiving/slitting, rotary/flatbed die cutting, kiss cutting, spooling, precision parts manufacturing, assembly, and much more.


Lab
Material Fabrication

We are ISO 9001:2015 and IATF 16949 certified with a wide selection of capabilities in converting foams, rubbers, and nonwoven fabrics for the OEMs and Tier 1 automotive industry. PLI will assist you in designing the exact components to meet your demanding specifications. We have extensive experience with 3M Adhesives and Avery Adhesives as well as years of sourcing the top foam, rubber, polymer, packaging, nonwoven, and fiber and film suppliers worldwide.

Capabilities

Our state-of-the-art facilities deliver the highest quality custom injection molded products to meet each customer’s unique specifications. By offering a variety of different mold types, we tailor a manufacturing approach to ensure no matter what kind of molding is needed, we have the right solution. Our investment in new technologies and the knowledge and skill development of our staff prepares us to handle any process, from simple to highly complex.

Learn More

The Ironwood Difference

From our beginnings in 1979, our vision has always been the same, “To be a world class injection molder of complex projects.” Today, we still remain true to our vision and use the latest technologies to manufacture the highest quality molds. This, in turn, leads to exceptional customer satisfaction.

Venture Plastics
With decades of experience, we deliver reliable quality service tailored to your needs. Trust in our expertise for all your injection molding solutions at our two modern facilities located in Newton Falls, Ohio and El Paso, Texas

Our well-diversified customer base includes, but is not limited to, the major markets of industrial/consumer, major appliance, truck/agriculture, automotive, fuel delivery, and communications.

While we are a very capable and efficient molder of parts, our offering goes much beyond this. Our engineering staff can assist in efficient part design and consolidation for cost reduction. Our program management skills provide quick turnaround from concept to production while relieving your internal resources for other needs. We can manage the production of tools from our sources around the world for high quality and low costs. Our process and quality control systems provide a consistent flow of good parts, eliminating the cost of scrap and rework. Value-added processes, such as finishing and assembly, provide an efficient single-source supplier.

About Us

We understand the importance of precision, durability, and functionality in plastic manufacturing and
strive to exceed our customers' expectations in every aspect.

Headquartered in North Venice, Florida, FUSION SKFIT LLC is a leading plastic manufacturer and supplier, committed to delivering high-quality plastic products to a diverse range of industries. With years of experience in the plastic manufacturing industry, we have established ourselves as a reliable and trusted source for all your plastic needs.

Read More 

At our state-of-the-art manufacturing facility, we utilize advanced technology and innovative processes to produce top-quality plastic products. Our international team of engineers and technicians are dedicated to making your custom parts using the most advanced equipment and techniques including multi-axis CNC machining and plastic injection molding. We’re here to turn your ideas into reality quickly, accurately and at a great price.

PLASTIC MANUFACTURER

Our Mission

Our mission is to provide sustainable and cost-effective plastic solutions that meet the unique requirements of our clients. We offer a comprehensive range of plastic manufacturing services, including:

We specialize in custom plastic manufacturing to meet the specific needs of our customers. Our experienced team works closely with you to understand your product requirements and design specifications. We leverage our in-house capabilities to develop and produce custom plastic products that meet your exact specifications.

Injection
Molding
Thermoforming
Custom Plastic Manufacturing

FUSION SKFIT LLC

Extrusion

We provide extrusion services to create plastic profiles, tubes, rods, and other shapes. Our advanced extrusion lines and skilled operators deliver precise and consistent extruded products. Whether you need standard profiles or custom-designed extrusions, we can fulfill your requirements.

Thermoforming

We specialize in thermoforming, which involves heating and shaping plastic sheets to create packaging, trays, and other products. Our thermoforming capabilities allow for precision and flexibility in developing custom products with excellent clarity, strength, and durability.

Product Assembly and Packaging

We offer product assembly and packaging services to provide a complete solution for your plastic products. Our assembly team can handle various components, ensuring efficient and accurate assembly. We also offer packaging services, including blister packing, shrink wrapping, labeling, and barcoding.

Why Us

FUSION SKFIT LLC offers unique business services as we focus exclusively on plastics manufacturing and provide unbiased manufacturing solutions based on your specific application and requirements. Our team has years of experience in the manufacturing arena and can offer keen insight into the latest material options, manufacturing processes, finishing & decorating techniques, and state-of-the-art technology.We offer services to produce plastic components of various shapes, sizes, and complexities. Our state-of-the-art equipment and skilled technicians ensure precise and efficient manufacturing processes, delivering high-quality plastic components for your specific applications.

Thermoforming Services

We provide thermoforming services to create custom plastic packaging and other products. We work closely with you to develop packaging solutions that reflect your brand and protect your products.

Plastic Manufacturing

In addition to plastic manufacturing, we offer product assembly and packaging services. Our team of experts can assemble, package, and label your plastic products, providing a seamless and efficient solution for your manufacturing needs.

At Hobas Pipe USA, Inc., we believe in creating a foundation for a better tomorrow. As the leading North American producer and supplier of corrosion-resistant, fiberglass reinforced polymer mortar pipe, we strive to ensure today’s solutions do not become tomorrow’s problems.

Opening the first U.S. office in 1987, Hobas is dedicated to engineering and manufacturing pipe solutions for municipalities that demand safe and reliable infrastructure. Today, we leverage market-leading technologies to produce a wide variety of critical solutions for municipal wet infrastructure for clients across the United States and Canada.

As a result, we have become the market leader with a superior reputation for exceptional pipe products and customer service. Our dedicated staff is motivated to make a difference for future generations through the products we sell.

Hobas is wholly owned by WIG Wietersdorfer Holding GmbH, a family-owned group of companies operating since 1893 and headquartered in Klagenfurt, Austria.

Technology Meets Performance

Proximity means local relationships, reduced transportation costs, just-in-time deliveries, and a partner you can interact with face-to-face.

Fabrication Focus
Cut to Size Acrylic Sheets and Parts

With a variety of CNC panel saws, table saws, and vertical panel saws, Acrilex can cut to size acrylic sheets and parts in small or large quantities. Choose the exact size of the acrylic sheet or panel you need to complete your project without waste.

Computerized panel saws are ideal for high volume rectangular cutting of parts. The precision of our cutting is within .010″ and multiple sheets can be stacked and cut to size simultaneously.

Learn More

Plastic Drilling and Machining

In addition to other plastic fabrication services, Acrilex offers plastic drilling and machining of parts from various stock plastic sheets. Despite our automation, many operations are still performed by skilled craftsmen on our Bridgeport milling and machining centers, stationary drill presses, hand routing stations, and hand routing & drilling stations.

Learn More

Laser Cutting of Plastic

Acrilex provides laser cutting of plastic and finished acrylic parts right off the laser machine! Laser cutters are outstanding for making fine detail, sharp corners, and smooth polished edges – all with the greatest accuracy. Lasers cut with speed and efficiency. Narrow kerf and close nesting of parts allows maximum yield per sheet to minimize cost, and polished edges eliminate the need for additional labor for proper aesthetics. 

Learn More

Acrylic Edge Polishing and Finishing

High capacity diamond edge polishing and finishing machines remove saw cut or routed edges and impart either a matte or high polished finish. Utilizing diamond equipment for acrylic edge polishing eliminates stress at the edges of parts which can lead to crazing down the road. Our equipment handles stacks of material and polishes many surfaces at once, making high quality polishing fast and economical. Hand Sanding, buffing, and flame polishing methods are also utilized for complex or curved edges and to reduce cost where the quality of diamond polishing is not required. 

Learn More

CNC Routing Plastic

CNC Routing plastic fabrication (Computer Numeric Controlled) components is an excellent method for producing high volumes of precision cut, complex plastic parts with repeatability, speed and accuracy. Acrilex has continuously upgraded its CNC routing capabilities with investments in the latest state of the art machinery. Acrilex’s behemoths can rout parts or panels up to 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each machine is equipped with four router heads that can reset their positions on the fly and shuttle between twin tables, and each head is equipped with a 8 bit tool changer.

Learn More

About REXtac

Based in Odessa, Texas, REXtac, LLC is focused on one thing – providing APAO (Amorphous Poly Alpha Olefin) adhesive and sealant solutions for clients worldwide. Dating back to 1986, REXtac APAO has been recognized as an industry leading, high quality olefin-based polymer capable of satisfying a wide range of applications and adhesive needs. REXtac polymers are available in four primary grades: Propylene homopolymers, Ethylene-propylene copolymers, 1-Butene-propylene copolymers and Ethylene-propylene-butene-1 terpolymers. REXtac’s flexible process technology, makes a product which is superior in its ability to be modified, combined, and blended to meet the most exact specifications for your application. REXtac APAO is simple to use and compatible with a wide variety of materials.

Learn More

WELCOME TO NISSEN CHEMITEC AMERICA INC.
PRECISION PLASTIC INJECTION MOLDING

 

Thank you for visiting the Nissen Chemitec America (NCA) website. We pride ourselves on producing high  quality plastic injection molded parts for the automotive industry  focusing on parts that require 700 to 2600 ton size machines. NCA is  located in the central Ohio community of London, which is approximately  30 minutes west of Columbus, Ohio.




NCA plays a major role in Nissen Chemitec Corporation’s global strategy, and in order to survive in a  very competitive global economy we not only focus on anticipating,  developing, and utilizing the latest technology, but also the continuing  education of our associates through associate involvement activities  and training. We are committed to Kaizen, to provide high quality  products with competitive pricing to our customers, and we endeavor to  be active contributors to our community, and our society. NCA is a  responsible steward of our environment through effective management,  reduction, and elimination of our waste streams.




Respect for each individual regardless  of title or position is the cornerstone of our company philosophy. We  have a dedicated group of associates who have been with us for several  years, and they are committed to exceeding our customer’s requirements.  Please take your time browsing our website. If you have any questions,  comments, or wish to make a business inquiry, please access our contact  page.

Nissen Chemitec America is a leading provider of high-quality plastic injection molding services. We specialize in manufacturing parts for the automotive industry, primarily serving Honda and Subaru. Our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with a range of injection molding machines, from 700 tons to 2500 tons, allowing us to handle a wide variety of projects. We are proud to be ISO 9001 and 14001 certified, ensuring the highest standards of quality and environmental responsibility in our operations.

Introducing Arcmed

Watch the Video

Transition Explained

Review FAQs

Simplifying the Design and Build of Diagnostic and Analytical Instruments

Arcmed helps solve the world’s toughest diagnostic and analytical challenges. We simplify the design and build of top-performing instruments that exceed your fluidics quality and performance requirements.

Escape the challenges and complexities of custom instrument design.
Streamlined Support by Experienced Design Partners

Building diagnostic and analytical instruments can be complex when your business needs fluidics expertise. We draw from 120+ years of combined experience, working collaboratively alongside you to save time and overcome tough design obstacles that create delays.

Streamlined Support by Experienced Design Partners

We know how challenging custom instrument design can be—at least when you’re not an expert in the industry. Let us do the heavy lifting for you so you can move forward with complete confidence in your designs and their components.

A responsive cross-functional team - We match you with a dynamic group of account managers, applications engineers, and manufacturing experts.
Dedicated model building team - We can quickly design, document, and build prototypes using advanced CAD and 3D modeling.
Manufacturing insight - Our cross-functional teams ensure your designs are efficiently and reliably manufactured to reduce verification and validation delays.
Learn more about Arcmed
Dependable Delivery Across the Instrument Lifecycle

Your business needs quick, easy access to a supply of fluidic parts. We design reliable, scalable, high-quality solutions with fast lead times on prototypes and dependable delivery on production assemblies.

Dependable Delivery Across the Instrument Lifecycle

Say goodbye to production delays and unreliable turnaround times. Leveraging our proven expertise and wide range of in-house capabilities, we can help ensure dependable delivery from start to finish across the entire instrument lifecycle.

Inventory management programs - We minimize lead times by providing a ready supply of components, helping you to operate a just-in-time materials program. 
Robust supply network - We meet delivery timelines on more than 2 million assemblies annually using our integrated in-house manufacturing capabilities, a supply chain network of more than 300 approved vendors, and thousands of validated materials.
Swift prototyping - Long and unreliable turnaround times in early development stages create delays that affect instrument delivery. Our engineering teams offer focused and responsive service to reduce lead times on prototypes.
World-class quality management - Refined over 30 years, our quality management processes are driven by best practices that are implemented across our five facilities on three continents.
Learn more about the services we offer
Products Designed to Meet Your Unique Challenges

Unlike vertically integrated competitors with a limited range of products, our experienced, responsive teams use a wide variety of configurable solutions to design around your organization’s unique challenges and needs.

Products Designed to Meet Your Unique Challenges

Access to limited selections of standard off-the-shelf fluidic components and accessories will hold your projects back, which is why we offer a wide variety of configurations, giving you the flexibility to easily customize components for your application.

A common design platform – We provide component compatibility to allow you more than 1 billion assembly combinations and integration with more than 35 product types. 
Built-in flexibility of standard components – Effortlessly customize your components including labels, wiring, mounting, tubing shape and length, circuit integration, electrical connections, materials, and colors.
Build everything you need with our subsystem expertise – Easily integrate and validate complex assemblies of multilayer manifolds, pumps, valves, tubing, fittings, and sensors.
Finished goods testing in our modern test labs – Test your systems’ mechanical, electrical, or functional performance, including pressure and leak testing.



History & Vision

IPL Macro™ has been driven by a spirit of innovation since the late 80’s when MacroBins were first introduced to the wine and stone fruit markets of California. IPL Macro™ places an exceptionally strong emphasis on quality management practices and safety in both daily operations and in regards to food storage and transportation. Concote Corporation Latest News

May 1, 2023
ESS vs BESS: What’s the Difference?

You can’t pick up an electrification industry trade magazine lately without reading about new developments in the field of energy storage. The technology offers numerous benefits… It can smooth demands on the local electrical grid, negate concerns with solar/wind energy fluctuations, lower costs to end-users by avoiding peak-rate surcharges, harness the outputs of multiple sources of renewable energy, provide backup capabilities for critical infrastructure (i.e. hospitals), delay local Governments needing to invest in costly grid improvements, and more.

Often, the acronyms ESS and BESS seem to be used interchangeably. Both refer to Energy Storage Systems, which are used to store and release energy, but there is a difference between the two.

ESS stands for "Energy Storage System." It is a broad term used to describe any system that stores energy for later use. This includes CHEMICAL (i.e. biofuels, hydrogen), ELECTROCHEMICAL (i.e. Batteries, Fuel Cells), ELECTROMAGNETIC (i.e. Inductors, Superconducting Magnets), THERMAL (i.e. latent heat), MECHANICAL (i.e. compressed air, flywheels), HYDRAULIC (i.e. pumped hydro storage, pressurized fluids) and HYBRID (i.e. battery-to-fuel cell) systems.

BESS stands for "Battery Energy Storage System." Because batteries store electric energy as chemical energy (then convert it back to an electrical form when needed), it is a type of ELECTROCHEMICAL ESS. As such, BESS is only one of many sub-categories of the broad "Energy Storage System” (ESS) framework.

June 1, 2022
Concote Moves Up on The Dallas Business Journal’s List

Concote Corporation, doing business as InsulFab and Spectape, is pleased to have once again been included on the Dallas Business Journal’s List of Top North Texas Manufacturing Companies, ranked by total local employment. Concote made the list at #10, up from its previous ranking of #18 from 2021. The Dallas Business Journal compiles a variety of business lists that appear in the Business Journal’s weekly edition and annual Book of Lists. Over the course of the prior two years, the North Texas Manufacturing List has included several of Concote’s Customers, such as Lockheed Martin, Envision Dallas, and Raytheon, as well as other large-scale regional manufacturers, including General Motors Arlington Assembly, Trinity Industries, and Bell Helicopter. With an overall North American workforce of approximately 200, Concote continues to grow remain a premier converter and fabricator of engineered materials for a variety of original equipment manufacturers.

May 6, 2022
Rogers Corporation Hosts InsulFab as Part of Its Preferred Converter Summit

Rogers Corporation, makers of silicone under the trade names Poron and Bisco, recently hosted its Preferred Converters Conference in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania during the first week of May. Although many companies fabricate and convert Rogers Engineered Materials, Preferred Converters maintain high standards of quality, technical capability and customer service ensuring the best possible experience for end-users. The three day educational summit focused heavily on electrification of vehicles and equipment. Significant investment is being made by Rogers and its Preferred Converters, like InsulFab, to meet the design challenges presented by Electric Vehicle battery packs, as well as those of the Electric Vehicle chargin and supply equipment.

April 4, 2022
InsulFab May or May Not Have Fabricated Materials for the Jets Featured in Top Gun: Maverick

Does InsulFab fabricate materials that are installed in the new fighter jets featured in the Paramount’s upcoming film, Top Gun: Maverick, schedule for released in May 2022? According to Shelby Ricketts, an aerospace product manager, it’s classified. “We could tell you, but then we’d have to kill you.”

In the movie, Maverick’s new ride is a Boeing F/A-18 Super Hornet and is a successor to the F/A-18 Hornet, with a 20% larger airframe, 33% more fuel capacity and 41% longer range. Top Gun: Maverick will also feature the F-35C, made by Lockheed Martin. The F-35C is the Navy’s aircraft carrier version of the Joint Strike Fighter, but with greater wing area, more robust landing gear and, of course, the requisite aircraft carrier landing hook.

As an AS 9100 aerospace and defense supplier to OEMs Boeing and Lockheed, InsulFab provides engineered insulation products that meet strict specifications for weight, flammability and density. High standards of quality, technical capability and regulatory compliance are not only expected, but demanded. As for whether or not InsulFab supplies materials for the fighter jets featured in Top Gun: Maverick, we prefer not to say.

How Can MDI Meet Your Challenge?

MDI has been providing excellence in molding and engineering for over 50 years. We have been integral in solving supply chain and contract manufacturing challenges for OEMs in every industry.

Expert Provider of Customized Plastic Injection Molding

With more than fifty years of serving a wide range of global markets, you can depend on us to provide the solutions you need for your plastic molding projects, on time and within the agreed budget.

Innovative Design in Our Custom Plastic Parts

No matter how demanding your specifications might be, we have the advanced machinery and skilled workforce to deliver. From the initial design and development phases, through production, assembly – we apply innovative engineering techniques to ensure your custom parts consistently meet a rigorous quality standard

Wide Range of Innovative Techniques
The techniques we offer include custom blow molding, dip molding & coating Services, injection molding services, as well as specialist solutions for medical injection molding applications.
Helping With Your Medical Product Design Needs

Do you have a great idea for a medical device? Medical device product development can be a difficult process without some professional guidance. We offer custom medical device contract manufacturing at various scales of production.

Plastic Injection Molding for the 21st Century

Our goal is to provide you with the exact parts you need, while also meeting your production and timeline requirements. Meticulous planning and attention to detail helps us move seamlessly from design to prototype to full-scale production, and provide quality injection molding services for a wide array of industries.

Engineering & Design

From the initial research and concept stages, to prototyping, mold design, and in-depth process & manufacturability analysis, you can count on our world-class engineering talent for a comprehensive product development solution.

High Volume | High Quality

With our advanced equipment, automation, expert operators, and state-of-the-art, real-time statistical process control, we pride ourselves in a commitment to quality that provides exactly what our customers want, when they need it.

Secondary Operations & Assembly

Our secondary operations include sonic welding, heat staking, pad printing, laser engraving, and more. Looking for assembly services? We can take that on as well! MDI can even serve as your warehousing and drop shipping solution.

Ultrasonic Welding

One of the most advanced secondary services offered at Molded Device Inc. is ultrasonic welding. Exceptionally fast, efficient and reliable – ultrasonic welding is one of the best methods for joining plastic parts and components, creating a durable and lasting bond

Molded Devices, Inc. offers world class plastic and rubber contract manufacturing services. We are one of only a handful of contract manufacturing companies that offers in-house design and engineering capabilities for a variety of product categories. Our advanced capabilities allow us to produce a wide array of custom molded products for companies in industries like medical device production, energy production, and aerospace and defense.
Beyond just our design and engineering capabilities, MDI has a nation-wide network of production facilities that can produce these advanced parts to almost any scale. We currently operate 12 dedicated manufacturing facilities in the United States, with 3 additional facilities in China, Canada, and Mexico. Every facility meets strict manufacturing standards specific to their industry, with 5 facilities meeting the FDA ISO 13485 standard, 3 facilities meeting the ISO 13485 standard, 5 facilities meeting the ISO 9001 standard, and 2 facilities meeting the TS 16949 standard. A combination of cutting-edge equipment, experienced staff, and a robust network of production facilities has helped solidify MDI as one of the top-names in molded device manufacturing.
Since our network of manufacturing facilities all concentrate on different industries, MDI is able to serve the needs of a wide-array of customers. We can handle almost any project – from custom plastic injection molding and plastisol dip coating, to medical device contract manufacturing services for products like catheters and airway management devices. We pride ourselves in our extensive custom capabilities and production capacity. Trust MDI to consistently produce high-quality plastic and rubber molded devices for your business needs. Ready to get started? Call us today at (920) 236-1280, or request a free quote.

Our Process sets you up for Success
C&J Industries is a full service plastic injection molding contract manufacturer and FDA certified medical device manufacturer. In other words, we do it all and with a high level of quality assurance. In case you’re unfamiliar with the process, it includes: product design and development, semi and full-automation, in-house tooling, manufacturing your plastic components, assembling, decorating, packaging and distributing them as well. C&J is a one-stop source for all your plastic contract manufacturing needs.

CONTRACT MANUFACTURING

C&J Industries offers a complete range of plastic contract manufacturing capabilities. We have developed considerable expertise in Printing, CNC Ultrasonic Welding, Heat Staking, Surface Coating Solutions, Laser Etching, Semi-Automatic, and Fully Automatic Assembly. For many of our customers, we are the private label manufacturer and ship the product directly to the end user. If your product requires assembly, decorating, mechanical fasteners, or special packaging, we have a solution for you.

PLASTIC SERVICES
MEDICAL SERVICES
PLASTIC INJECTION MOLDING

C&J Industries is a single source for all your high precision plastic injection molding needs. We have the certifications, state-of-the-art equipment, years of experience, and capacity to fulfill your plastic injection molding project. C&J is an ISO 13485:2016 and ISO 9001:2015 certified medical injection molding company. We have been FDA registered for the manufacture of medical devices and plastic molded components since 1981.

PLASTIC SERVICES
MEDICAL SERVICES
PRODUCT DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT

C&J Industries has been providing plastic Part Design and Product Development services for nearly 20 years. The key to successful Plastic Product Design and Development is speed and experience. C&J has 27 engineers on staff that utilize the latest software including Creo and SolidWorks used for both product and tool design. Our full suite of SIGMASOFT (mold flow simulation) software provides a predictive tool for mold design analysis. C&J also has in-house Rapid Prototyping capabilities to reduce the product revision development cycle.

LEARN MORE
Tooling Services: 10 Year Mold Warranty

Our Tool Building capabilities are the driving force of our success. C&J offers both prototype and production tooling. We also provide low volume machining services for a wide variety of applications: Assembly Fixtures, Gauges and Tooling Components (referred to as Small Tooling). Great quality and fulfillment of critical plastic components or complete contract assemblies begin with outstanding injection molds. We don’t just build great tools; we back it up with a unique production tooling warranty.*

LEARN MORE
Our Team = Your Success

C&J Industries continually invests by improving our facilities and advancing our technology in both contract manufacturing and plastic injection molding. In 2020 we expanded our manufacturing space by 50,000 sq ft when we purchased a neighboring building and remodeled it. We have added best-in-class, all-electric plastic injection molding presses and tripled our clean room molding capabilities. Our tool shop has some of the highest speed and closest tolerance machining capabilities in the industry.

Partnering with C&J Industrie’s team of professionals produces measurable results.

KYD IS NOW PFAS FREE!

KYD is proud to announce that we have successfully transitioned to a PFAS-free production process. PFAS, which stands for per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances, are a group of chemicals that have been linked to various health and environmental risks. By removing PFAS from our products, we demonstrate our commitment to sustainability and customer satisfaction. This transition will improve our products' quality and safety while reducing environmental impact. We appreciate your continued support and trust in reducing our environmental impact. 




At KYD Inc., we are passionate about protecting the environment in Hawaii. Our commitment to preserving the environment goes beyond recycling or using eco-friendly products. It also involves using resources wisely, minimizing waste, and being committed to reducing, recycling, repurposing, and reusing. 

Read more

Our Honolulu manufacturing plant is a prime example of our dedication to the environment. We use photovoltaic systems that generate electricity, reducing our reliance on non-renewable energy sources. Our inventory includes many eco-friendly, sustainable, and compliant products, such as leak-proof, disposable, biodegradable, reusable containers, bags, chemicals, food service ware, paper towels, tissues, napkins, and more. We even collaborate with other manufacturers to create innovative items using cutting-edge materials. 




As a leading player in the packaging industry, we take our responsibility to the environment seriously. We deliver superior products that meet and exceed environmentally responsible standards by leveraging our expertise, knowledge, and strength. Our environmentally friendly products protect the planet, and our goal is to empower our customers to minimize their carbon footprint.




Join us in our mission to achieve sustainability goals and create a cleaner, greener world for future generations. By partnering with KYD Inc., you can be confident that you are getting superior products that are both cost-effective and environmentally responsible.

KYD part of Oahu‘s ohana since 1946

For over 75 years, KYD, Inc. has been proud to serve Hawaii as an essential part of Oahu's ohana. Our commitment to sharing the aloha spirit of joy and love with our island, ohana, is unwavering, and we celebrate and embrace the rich cultural and racial diversity that makes our island unique. As an ancient Hawaiian proverb teaches us, "He wa'a he moku, he moku he wa'a." A canoe is an island, and our island is a canoe.  At KYD, Inc., our goal is to continue to serve our community with the utmost dedication and care, as we have done since 1946.

Packaging and Distribution Services in Honolulu, HI

KYD Inc. is a company that aims to provide you with high-quality and innovative packaging products and distribution services at competitive prices. We believe in providing innovative and creative solutions that meet your needs and align with our commitment to preserving the environment.




For over seven decades, we've supplied businesses, schools, medical facilities, and organizations with top-tier paper products, trays and films, and disposable containers. Our team is driven by 


excellence and is always ready to go the extra mile to ensure you get the most reliable products and services.




From our headquarters in Honolulu, HI, we have built a reputation as a trusted and reliable partner in the packaging industry. Please contact us today to learn more about our packaging and distribution services, and let us help you take your business to the next level.

SPECIFICATIONS
HOW FRP COMPARES
TO TRADITIONAL STRUCTURAL MATERIALS
INSTALLED COST
Because installation of Strongwell FRP is much simpler than steel, structures built using Strongwell’s pultruded products can cost as much as 15% less than carbon steel, 30% less than galvanized steel, and as much as 50% less than stainless steel.
STRENGTH-TO-WEIGHT
Pound-for-pound, EXTREN® pultruded fiberglass structural shapes are stronger than steel in the lengthwise direction. Strongwell FRP weighs up to 75% less than steel and 30% less than aluminum – ideal when weight and performance counts.

EASY INSTALLATION
FRP costs on average 20% less than steel to install with less down time, less equipment, and less specialized labor. Avoid costly specialized labor and heavy equipment, and speed the construction process by using Strongwell pultruded structural products.
CORROSION RESISTANT
Fiber reinforced polymer (FRP) composites offer resistance to a broad range of chemicals and harsh environments. Strongwell offers a full corrosion resistance guide to ensure the performance of its products in some of the toughest conditions.
TRANSPARENCY
Several of Strongwell’s pultruded products are L.A.R.R. certified for RF transparent screening and enclosures. Even in low temperature settings, pultruded fiberglass remains a poor electrical and thermal conductor, and offers high dielectric capabilities.

MAINTENANCE FREE
Strongwell FRP is durable and impact resistant. It will not dent or deform like metals. Resists rot and corrosion, eliminating the need for constant maintenance. This combination of performance and durability offers the ideal solution in numerous applications.

Our Companies

Whether working with small shops or global partners, we bring effective solutions to our customers through our two businesses, Guardian Glass and SRG Global.

Guardian Glass

Guardian Glass is Guardian’s largest business and ​one of the world’s largest manufacturers of float, ​value-added and fabricated glass products and solutions. At its 24 float lines around the world, Guardian Glass produces high performance glass for architectural, residential, interior, transportation and technical glass applications. You’ll find our glass in homes, offices and cars and in some of the world’s most iconic projects.

Go to Guardian Glass
SRG Global

SRG Global® is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of integrated, functional decorative systems for the automotive, mobility, and commercial truck industries. SRG Global has a manufacturing presence in major world regions including North America, Western and Central Europe, and Asia.

GDC YOUR TOTAL SOLUTIONS PARTNER
GDC Corporation is the leading vertically integrated manufacturer of engineered foam, rubber and plastic components.

We have been a trusted supplier to the biggest names in the automotive, agricultural, industrial, and recreational vehicle industries for over 60 years. GDC has the capabilities, experience and expertise to deliver optimal solutions for your component needs.

Innovative Engineered Materials and Components

GDC's proprietary and custom-engineered compounds, including Sonozorb® and Enduraprene® outperform any other option on the market. With superior durability, resistance to harsh environments, and enhanced functional properties our precision engineered materials deliver reliable, long-lasting performance.

LEARN MORE 
Unmatched Breadth of Capabilities

We offer an impressive array of manufacturing processes – injection molding, blow molding, extrusion, compression molding, overmolding, insert molding, and multi-step complex sub-assemblies. No matter the criteria, we can provide the most optimal, cost-effective solution.

LEARN MORE 
Solutions for the Most Demanding Applications

GDC's engineered foam, rubber and plastic solutions span automotive, agricultural, industrial and recreational vehicle markets. As a trusted Tier 1 and 2 supplier, we meet or exceed the most stringent requirements and deliver products tailored to each market's distinct applications.

ENERGY, OIL & GAS
Unparalleled Benefits for Energy & Oil

Manufactured using the flat die calendered extrusion process, AGRU America’s HDPE and LLDPE geomembranes deliver numerous benefits including containment, stability, chemical resistance, and cost savings. All AGRU geomembranes, geocomposites, geotextiles, geonets, geosynthetic clay liners, and other geosynthetic materials are manufactured in the U.S. and meet stringent quality control standards.

These geomembranes and geosynthetic products offer unparalleled benefits for energy, oil, and gas applications.

LEARN MORE
ENVIRONMENTAL
The Highest Degree of Containment

When it comes to the environment, it pays to use the best waste management solutions available. As the industry-leading producer of geosynthetics in North America, AGRU America and its flat die calendered extrusion process delivers the highest and most consistent quality geomembrane and geosynthetic products for environmental applications. Our products are the perfect solution for applications requiring the highest degree of containment, stability, chemical resistance, and erosion prevention.

LEARN MORE
CCR APPLICATIONS
Beating the New Challenges of CCR

The EPA’s ruling on the disposal of coal combustion residuals has defined the standard for successful containment and closure of coal combustion residuals (CCR) facilities. Since then, AGRU America has been committed to becoming the supplier of choice for CCR-related applications.

Discover industry-leading geosynthetics specially designed for the closure and containment of CCR. Manufactured to meet even the most stringent project parameters, AGRU’s products provide state-of-the-art solutions for CCR impoundments and landfills.

LEARN MORE

Best-in-Class Service

We are your Plastics Experts. AGRU is an international manufacturer of innovative engineering plastics that is always prepared to meet challenges with robust solutions. AGRU develops the highest quality products for applications ranging from waste management and water conservation to mining and energy.

Our award-winning research has led to the development of our flat-die calendered extrusion process, which can produce geomembranes with unique surface structures such as spikes or drain studs. And our constant focus on research and development has led to numerous breakthroughs in lining systems, HDPE piping systems, concrete protection, and more.

Since 1988, we have been committed to offering our customers the highest quality products and long-term solutions. That commitment is only made possible by our competent staff and their willingness to challenge accepted norms. With worldwide locations, an AGRU representative is always on standby to help.

Welcome to Cortec® Corporation

World Class Corrosion Solutions from Cortec® Corporation

Cortec® Corporation is committed to providing world class corrosion solutions for industries across the globe. As the global leader in innovative, environmentally responsible VpCI® and MCI® corrosion control technologies, Cortec® seeks to deliver cost-effective, user-friendly integrated solutions for corrosion problems in packaging, metalworking, construction, electronics, oil and gas, and many other industries.

Customer Centric

Cortec® focuses on providing individualized solutions that meet the specific needs of the customer, paired with responsive customer service and a strong record of quick turnarounds and on-time shipments.

Insightful R&D

Through research, testing, and direct knowledge of end user needs, Cortec® R&D continues an ongoing cycle of product discovery and improvement. Cortec’s innovation is evident in the development of over 400 products and the acquisition of more than 60 patents since 1977. Supporting this successful R&D program is the only ISO/IEC -17025 accredited lab in the industry, an accreditation that also enables Cortec® to provide valuable testing services to its customers.

Vertical Integration and Quality

Cortec® is seeking to make its wide range of corrosion solutions more accessible as plants, distribution facilities, offices, and distributors increase globally. Specialized plants allow Cortec® to produce specific product categories while vertically integrating in order to deliver quality corrosion inhibiting options.

An Expanding Portfolio of Solutions

Cortec’s wide variety of corrosion inhibiting solutions include time-tested general VpCI® and MCI® Technology for use in effectively any industry that battles rust. Cortec® continues to grow as a specialty chemical company committed to finding more environmentally friendly solutions for its customers.

Cortec® began this journey by offering organic corrosion inhibiting chemistries at a time most companies still relied on inorganic chemistries. Cortec® moved on to its second technological platform with the introduction of biodegradable and biobased building blocks and now offers a growing portfolio of USDA certified biobased products.

As it continues to expand its diverse technological portfolio, Cortec® is eager to help end users find the best solution for their corrosion needs.

TEMPERATURE SOLUTIONS
Ideation to Conception
Decades of Premier Packaging Solutions

Founded in 1954, EFP, LLC. is a leader in protective packaging, consumer packaging, cold chain solutions, and packaging supply chain services. Headquartered in Elkhart, Indiana, EFP has locations in Evansville, Indiana, La Vergne, Tennessee, Decatur, Alabama, and Reno, Nevada providing coverage to the west coast and mid-America from Canada to the Gulf of Mexico. EFP is owned by J.B. Poindexter & Co., a privately held, diversified manufacturing company with operating subsidiaries throughout North America. EFP is committed to innovating current products, creating sustainable solutions, and providing services that support our corporate purpose of Protecting What Matters.

Best in Class Tooling and Automation

Delivered On Time, Every Time!

With roots that go back over 40 years, Tooling Tech Group (TTG) has grown to be the leading manufacturer of tooling in the United States. We provide solutions for thermoform molding, high compression composite molding, blow molding, rotational molding, die casting and stamping, as well as custom automated systems for assembly, joining and inspection applications. Our combination of industry expertise and depth of resources means that we provide tooling and automated solutions of the highest quality on time, every time!
Automated Solutions & Tooling, Molds and Dies
We Are Ready to Serve

At the pace of business today, manufacturers need to try and simplify their supply chain, while finding partners they know they can absolutely rely upon to deliver. We believe that Tooling Tech Group can fulfill those requirements. As a leading manufacturer of tooling throughout the United States, we provide solutions for thermoform molding, high compression composite molding, blow molding, rotational molding, die casting, and stamping, as well as custom automated systems for assembly, joining and inspection applications. The depth and breadth of our capabilities is achieved through the combined experience of our four division, each composed of companies that have all been in business for 30+ years, proving out both industry experience and financial stability. Simply put, Tooling Tech Group offers the largest selection of capabilities and capacity to get your jobs accomplished under one roof.

Lee Childers, Chief Executive Officer

In-House Foundry

Having our own in-house foundry gives Tooling Tech Group an advantage over smaller, less-advanced tooling companies, resulting in lower costs, faster lead times, and complete control over the quality of your tooling.

Single Source for Tooling & Automation

Since our initial founding, Tooling Tech Group has earned a reputation for being a trusted source for high quality products and services in each of our four divisions, leveraging each group’s strengths.

On Time, Every Time, Period!

Whether we produce your tool, try it out and dial it in your imported dies, or run production parts, we ensure that you received the highest quality results on time. Make us an integral part of our supply chain.

New Capacity is Online

Last summer we announced a 70,000 sq. ft. expansion of our Macomb Township Majestic Industries’ progressive die and stamping facility, and here are the results. This brief video offers a tour of this newly expanded facility, highlighting our 2,750-ton automated press line. We continue to invest in our Tooling Tech Group family, ensuring that we serve our customers’ needs on time, every time.

Largest leading provider of tooling and automation solutions

We build custom tooling for a variety of applications including thermoforming, compression molding, blow molding, die casting, and stamping, as well as secondary equipment and automated solutions for these applications.

Segen Quick-Change

Our Segen™ line of quick-change components can help any manufacturer achieve their lean manufacturing goals. These systems replace nuts, bolts, fasteners and hand tools to significantly reduce the time wasted on industrial setups, changeovers, workholding, clamping, fixturing and alignment.

We do so by applying our expertise and the latest technology, techniques, and CNC equipment to design, engineer, manufacture and test your tooling. In all that we do, you can rely on us to deliver on time, every time.

CERTIFICATIONS >

SWPC adheres to ASTM standards and diligent quality control methods, implementing testing data along with decades of expertise.

PLASTIC INJECTION MOLDING

Advances in materials and in molding toolmaking technology have opened virtually endless possibilities for injection-molded plastic components. We offer complete rapid prototyping, tooling and injection molding services — from the most common to the most exotic engineered resins.

Read More
METAL FORGING

Of all the ways to shape metal, the only one to shape it while making it stronger and more durable is forging. That’s what makes our products known for their strength and durability: our expertise in forging steel, stainless, aluminum and scandium into tough, long-lasting components.

Our metal forging division produces raw forging blanks or near-net shape parts from aluminum, carbon or stainless steel.

Read More
HEAT TREATING

The same piece of metal can be soft and malleable, resilient and springy or hard enough to carve stone. It is tuned by carefully controlled heat treating. The longevity and dependability of Smith & Wesson products are due, in part, to our heat treating facilities and skills.

Controlling the physical properties of metal is achievable through various heat treating methods such as annealing, hardening and quenching.

Read More
PLATING & FINISHING

Metal finishing operations — oxide coatings, plating, blasting and tumbling —can protect components from corrosion, enhance their function and make them more beautiful. Our skill in plating and finishing operations is easy to see in our firearms — and in the components we finish for manufacturers like you.

Metal finishing processes can not only protect components from corrosion, but can also enhance function and improve cosmetics.

Read More

TECHNICAL AND MANUFACTURING EXPERTISE

S&A Industries is a manufacturer of products used for thermal protection, air and gas conveying and noise attenuation in automotive air management systems. Typical applications are thermal reflective sleeving to protect hoses; pipe assemblies, wire harnesses and cable assemblies acoustically tuned, porous flexible ducting used for air intake sound attenuation; flexible ducting for air conveying and re-circulation. Superior Quality, Outstanding Performance

At Federal Package we provide a wide range of propel and repel containers for lip balms, sunscreen sticks, anti-chafe products, deodorants, and other personal care products. 

We offer customers a variety of sustainable container options through our Eco Smart platform that includes post-consumer recycled (PCR) and post-industrial recycled (PIR) plastic content as well as biodegradable options for a more environmentally-responsible alternative.

Quality Containers for Any Skincare Application
Federal Package specializes in personal care container production from .05 oz to 3.0 oz

We specialize in propel-repel containers for lip balm, deodorant, anti-chafe, and more! Choose from our variety of containers for just about any application.

EXPLORE CUSTOM CONTAINERS
Complete Skincare Manufacturing, Start to Finish
FP Labs is your go-to resource for personal care formulations and manufacturing

We are ready to meet you on your skincare product journey. Our commitment to creating top-quality skin and personal care products is unsurpassed.

START YOUR SKINCARE JOURNEY TODAY
Generations of Experience

With over 40 years of experience in container design and development, Federal Package are the perfect solution for your beauty and personal care needs. Let us put our technology, creativity, and experience to work for you.

Eco Smart® Containers

Eco Smart by Federal Package is an earth-conscious sustainability solution for the global personal care market that is fully FDA-compliant and made in the USA. This proprietary technology enables plastic components to break down in biologically active environments while providing the same form, fit, and function as our standard line of containers.

Our containers are recyclable with biodegradable additives to accelerate decomposition in biologically active landfills, marine, or other environments in less than eight years.

Other sustainable container solutions include light-weighting (containers using less plastic) or using Post-Consumer Recycled Resins (PCR), Post-Industrial Recycled Resins (PIR), and plant-based bio-resins.

Our sustainable packaging is scientifically tested and validated, FDA-compliant, and made in the USA.

You’ll Know When It’s a Norton

1901: Established

Bernard W. Norton establishes a small custom tool shop in Oakland, California, making custom-stamped metal parts for local industries.

WHY COMPOSITES?
Remember the old adage “the whole is greater than the sum of its parts?” That’s the advantage of composite materials in a nutshell—two or more materials combined to form an even stronger material. But the benefits go beyond strength:
Remarkable customization
Stronger and lighter than traditional materials
Thick or thin walled applications
Durable, with corrosion resistance
Elevated temperature performance
Nonconductive and nonmagnetic

Founded in 1974, MANAR has a depth and breadth of experience few other custom plastic manufacturing companies can claim. We are proud to share that our very first customer is still with us today. We strive to create and maintain long-term partnerships and believe our growth is a testimony to our commitment to provide quality thermoplastic solutions at competitive prices.

We demonstrate success and credibility as we follow continuous improvement philosophy while we manufacture critical, high-precision plastic components. We have successfully partnered with Fortune 100 companies and small start-up businesses, in many different industries like healthcare, automotive and transportation, lawn & garden, power sports and electronics.

With four ISO-Certified facilities, three IATF 16949:2016 Certified facilities and two ISO13485 facility in the Mid-West, MANAR is ready to take on your next challenge.

A Strategic Look Ahead

While MANAR is a company built on tradition, we recognize that we’ve thrived by always looking forward. We are aggressive in our approach to business and never afraid to take a calculated risk. We invest in the latest technologies and top industry talent, and because we are customer-centric we can make fast decisions that move our business and customers forward.

MANAR takes great pride in having our quality management system certified to industry standards ISO 9001, ISO 13485, and IATF 16949. Our commitment to delivering quality products is showcased by our facilities maintaining a certification-compliant system and continuous efforts for improvement to better serve our valued customers.

For more information or copies of our certifications, please contact us to match you with the Manar branch that best suits your needs.

To Download Our Certifications, Visit the Appropriate Location Page.

Zur OKE Group
Products Services Facilities About us Working at Global Enterprises Contact

Worldwide Automotive
Seating Solutions
Striving to exceed every customer expectation

We are recognized as a world-class, quality certified supplier of plastic extrusions for automotive seating.

Global has earned a loyal customer following through the delivery of quality products, delivered in a timely and cost-effective manner. Many of our customers have been doing business with us since our inception, proving our ability to not only satisfy our customers needs, but to grow with them as well.

Contact us
Our products
Fastening profiles for car seats

For over thirty years, our technically sophisticated extruded plastic profiles have been firmly and securely connecting covers to the metal structure of the vehicle seat, they pad and give contours.

In extrusion, we process all thermoplastics and compounds developed in-house, which are joined with complementary materials such as non-wovens and tapes. Foamed profiles complement our extensive range. Our products are usually finished directly inline and receive longitudinal cuts, markings, printing, complex stamping or laser contours. The result is absolutely precise and offers maximum cost efficiency and tolerance accuracy!

You can trust:
uniform high quality standard worldwide
guaranteed global availability of our products
expert know-how in the automotive industry and in extrusion processes combined with state-of-the-art production facilities
central control of worldwide projects with local contacts
short reaction times and high flexibility

Just use the contact form at the end of this site. We’re here for you!

Member of the OKE Group

As an international partner, we support our customers with all technologies at each of our locations.

View all locations
Working at Global

Harmonise work, family and health. As part of the OKE Group of Companies, we offer many opportunities for your career entry, career change or new perspectives at our locations in Lübbecke and Hörstel. Find out more here about Alhorn as an employer!

Working at Global Enterprises
Our ideas, our solutions
Profiles

We keep it as simple as possible: Our profiles help to attach fabrics to the metal structure of seats, they can be very simple or made of different materials to prevent noises, to seal or are used as shock absorbers.

Find out more
Tiedowns

Tiedowns and clip-systems help to implement individual designs. Tuftings get easy to implement and reliable with our different solutions.

Find out more
Duoflex

Duoflex – also called Polymelts, are profiles with a non-woven flange and a special shape. We use stamping or laser technology for complex outlines. These products help to save sewings, cover materials or carpet and are even suitable for sophisticated designs.

Find out more
Specials

We combine plastics and complementary materials, and we punch and laser cut a wide variety of materials. This enables us to find efficient solutions even for complex tasks!

Find out more
Sheets

Our sheet extrusion allows flat plates and strips to be produced at a fraction of the injection mold costs traditionally seen in the market, both in piece price and tooling costs.

Find out more

WHO WE ARE

For 140 years, The H&K Perforating Companies have been the partner of choice for value-added metal and non-metallic perforated services for the markets we serve. H&K's ability to perforate from foil thin to one-inch-thick material differentiates us from our competition.

We are the only independently owned perforating company with a national footprint allowing close customer collaboration and short delivery times. We build deep relationships with our customers to efficiently solve complex requirements at competitive prices. Our flexible operating model and manufacturing footprint provides customers the option to customize production to meet their specific needs.

READ FURTHER ABOUT US!

USED BY A WIDE RANGE OF COMPANIES THAT SPAN ACROSS NORTH AMERICA

Proudly serving our customers nationwide from three facilities!
Why Choose H&K For All of Your Perforating Needs
Focus & Attention
from Leadership

We pair our customers up with an inside account representative, building relationships to better serve their needs. We cannot grow unless our customers are growing first. This allows us the opportunity to react in a timely, knowledgeable and respectful manner with any needs that arise.

Better Integration into Planning & Logistics

Our three facilities are near major transportation infrastructure. Our locations are ideally suited to seamlessly integrate with our customers planning, logistics and delivery schedules. With Sales & Production facilities in 3 locations (Chicago, IL – Carbondale, PA – Cleveland, TN), we can provides services that best suites our customers. Our plant network provides redundant capabilities and flexibility to meet tight lead times while minimizing freight.

Flexible Pricing
Options & Service

We pride ourselves in customizing solutions to our customers needs. We pride ourselves on flexibility and meeting our customers’ specific needs. We can order on our customer’s behalf or receive customer supplied materials. Our release programs provide our customers the savings and efficiency of larger orders while we manage delivery and planning to meet their production requirements. Learning how our customers operate, assisting in planning material deliveries and consistent communication until order receipt is part of the value in partnering with The H&K Perforating Companies.

Plus we work with the top engineers to ensure EXCELLENCE

H&K Perforating will liaise with the architectural and engineering teams to address any pain points they experience. We can help resolve issues such as design changes, open area needs, whistling, and aesthetic recommendations just to name a few. We will work hand-in-hand with your client to address specific needs big or small.

Perforated Metal is all around you!
Applications

Perforated materials are used in a wide variety of industries and applications. These industries require strong, durable perforations with precise hole design and placement, delivered within customers tight production timelines.

Recent Articles
AUGUST 31, 2023
The Future of Perforated Metal: Emerging Trends in 2023 and Beyond

Perforated metal, with its unique blend of functionality and aesthetics, has been a cornerstone in various industries for decades. As we navigate through 2023, it's essential to stay abreast of the latest trends shaping the perforated metal landscape. Here's a deep dive into what's on the horizon.

AUGUST 31, 2023
Unveiling Our Journey with CBS 2: Crafting Metal, Creating Community

Step into the world of The H&K Perforating Companies as CBS 2 takes you on a journey through our longstanding legacy of innovation and dedication to our communities. From our humble beginnings over a century ago to our present-day nationwide reach, we've been shaping industries and supporting neighborhoods. Join us in celebrating our 100-year milestone in Austin with a special back-to-school event that captures the essence of our commitment. Explore how we've partnered with communities, contributed to projects like microwaves and filtration systems, and discover the future we're forging through creativity and collaboration.

JULY 25, 2023
Fortifying Home Community is Foundational to The H&K Perforating Companies

The H&K Perforating Companies, a leader in metal perforating, is hosting a Back-to-School Fest on August 18, 2023, to celebrate the academic season and give back to the Chicago community. The event will feature food, giveaways, performances, school supplies, and a raffle, as the company marks its 100th year in its Chicago location and reiterates its commitment to support the community.

Paper or Plastic: Sustainable Cards Are the Wave of the Future

Cards made from paper and other sustainable materials continue to gain in popularity. In addition to lower environmental impacts, paper cards are cost-effective and perfect for single-use purposes, such as gift cards.

Learn more about the Power of Paper in this Payments Journal Podcast with Peggy O'Leary.

Source: Payments Journal

Accuma S.p.A. is specialized, from over 40 years, in production by injection moulding, of components for electric accumulators in thermoplastic material. Since some years produces also, through cold forging, lead terminals for automotive battery lids. Our products are supplied to electric batteries industries for production of automotive, traction, stationary and recombination batteries. Accuma is today present with its production plants in Italy and, through its associate companies in United Kingdom, Germany and United States of America.

Who We Are

Fiberesin Industries, located in Oconomowoc, Wisconsin manufactures solid phenolic and high performance panels (HPP). These materials are found in products such as office and school furniture, ergonomic desk accessories, cabinets, medical carts and furniture, x-ray tables, windows and doors. As a tier one OEM supplier to these competitive industries, Fiberesin manufactures components to finished assemblies.

The Oconomowoc, Wisconsin plant utilizes proprietary technology to thermally fuse laminates (resin-infused paper or wood veneers) with or without wood core materials into panels offering exceptional performance, strength, appearance and consistency. Panels are then fabricated into custom parts for our customers.

All Fiberesin Products are Proudly Made in America

Who we are

The POLIFILM Group

We are a second generation family-run company and global leader in the manufacture of extrusion and protection films.

With 11 production facilities in 7 countries, 13 sales offices and more than 20 distribution partners worldwide, we are a global film specialist who provides our international customers with solutions for a variety of markets and applications in over 60 countries worldwide.

MORE ABOUT US
All from a single source
Extrusion films, Protective films, Trade & Recycling
Certified quality
37 certifications worldwide
Available for you worldwide
through our production sites, sales offices & distribution partners
Leaders in the circular economy
with the new POLICYCLE division / return concept

SUSTAINABILITY

We are convinced of the technological versatility of plastics and the resulting advantages for users and consumers in specific applications. In order to develop these, conscious handling – from sourcing to disposal – is a key function. Therefore, we focus on the establishment of cycles, Design For Recyling and a balance of social, ecological and economic priorities.

WHAT WE DO

CERTIFICATIONS

Whether it’s an integrated management system, assured process, production conditions or transparency at product level – we ensure we keep our word and deliver on our promises to our customers and partners.This is precisely why we supplement our internal audits worldwide with independent, external audits. This not only provides reassurance to our international business partners, but also helps us to constantly improve.  

WE ARE CERTIFIED

LOCATIONS

Close to our customers – this has been one of our fundamental principles for decades.In this way we can provide you, our customers, with the local contact, excellent service and advice that you require whilst at the same time offering reduced transportation times and flexibility in the production and supply chain.

WHERE TO FIND US

SUBGROUPS

One family. 4 subgroups. One goal: to provide you with Excellence in Films every day. Discover POLIFILM EXTRUSION, POLIFILM PROTECTION, POLIFILM TRADING and POLICYCLE and how their interaction can benefit you.

ABOUT CMI
Revolutionizing the Markets We Serve

CMI is the leading manufacturer and fabricator of engineered products providing solutions for marine walls, flood-levee protection, water control, chemical containment, soil stabilization, groundwater cut-off, aluminum bridges, gangways, docks and industrial access applications.
‍
We are driven to enable access and protection of shorelines and waterways while leading advancements in soil stabilization for all types of land and water use through our commitment to innovation. We strive to provide a lower total cost of ownership using alternative and sustainable materials to address an evolving climate and approaches to land use.

Our Products
Vinyl Sheet Piling

ShoreGuard® vinyl sheet pile provides a cost-effective and sustainable building material for seawalls and other sheet piling structures.

Aluminum Docks & Gangways

GatorDock® fabricated marine access systems are designed and built to be a high performance, long lasting, cost-efficient solution to harsh marine environments.

Aluminum Bridges

FRP Composite Sheet Piling

Aluminum Sheet Piling

Polymer Encapsulated Treated Wood

TimberGuard® polymer protection system is resistant to rot, UV and marine borer damage which are the main sources of traditional wood piling failure.

Athletic Fencing

Installation Equipment

The PileClaw® steel mandrel drives your vinyl or composite sheet piling more efficiently in the most challenging installation environments.

Sheet Piling Accessories

ArmorWare™ components and accessories are designed to match the longevity and service life of our most popular sheet piling products.

Aluminum Platforms & Stairs

GatorAccess aluminum utility solutions are a fraction of the weight of steel and more resistant to rust and natural wear making them ideal for industrial settings and your budget.

Modular Trail Bridge System

Cumberland Trail Bridge system components can be carried to remote site locations by hand or ATV and assembled with basic hand tools in lengths ranging from 20’ to 60’.

Sustainability

Building a greener future, one package at a time.

As a leading provider of systems-based product protection solutions, Pacron is on a mission to enhance supplier performance, reduce packaging cost, and lower our impact on the planet. 

A tall order? Maybe. But we’re not afraid of a challenge.

Explore Our Sustainability Commitments
Our most valuable package yet: the planet.

The earth is where we live, where we work, and where we raise future generations. 
We’ve partnered with the following organizations to help protect that legacy: 

Our SFI® certification promotes responsible material sourcing that supports the long-term health of North American forests.

Our FSC® certification ensures our raw paper material comes from responsibly managed forests, supporting environmental conservation.

Our EcoVadis partnership strengthens our sustainability commitments, enabling us to enhance our ESG performance and promote positive environmental impact throughout our supply chain.

Collaborating with industry leaders to innovate and implement environmentally responsible practices in our protective packaging designs.

Our How2Recycle (H2R) membership enables us to use standardized recycling labels on our products. These clear, consistent labels guide consumers on proper disposal methods, promoting more effective recycling practices.

Careers

Join the team of tomorrow.

Make a difference for the planet, your community, and the many businesses that help support our way of life – all while building a promising career ripe with opportunity.
